*   The problem of salient object detection, which involves identifying the most visually appealing object in a scene, has been a topic of interest in computer vision research. 
    \t*   Current models have focused on scenes with single objects, but real-world scenes often contain multiple objects, making it challenging to detect the most salient one.
    \t*   The goal of salient object detection is to simulate human attention and prioritize objects for high-level processing, with applications in recognition, image and video compression, and more.
    \t*   A widely-agreed objective definition of the most salient object is still lacking, and existing datasets suffer from biases such as low scene clutter and center-bias.

*   The authors propose a new benchmark dataset, bruce-a, which contains 681 images with explicit saliency judgments and free-viewing fixations. 
    \t*   The dataset is designed to challenge existing state-of-the-art salient object detection models and provide a more realistic representation of real-world scenes.
    \t*   The authors also propose a simple baseline model for salient object detection, which involves two steps: fixation prediction and segmentation.
    \t*   The model is designed to be computationally efficient and can be used as a baseline for future research.

*   The authors evaluate their model on three datasets: msra-5k, bruce-a, and judd-a. 
    \t*   The results show that the model performs well on the msra-5k dataset but struggles on the more complex bruce-a and judd-a datasets.
    \t*   The authors analyze the reasons for the performance drop and identify two main issues: inaccurately highlighting the salient object and segmenting the wrong object.
    \t*   The authors suggest that future research should focus on addressing these issues and developing more robust salient object detection models.
</summary>

    •  The Heegaard Floer homology is a combinatorial invariant, meaning that it can be computed using a finite number of steps, and it is a powerful tool for studying the properties of 4-manifolds with boundary.

*   The paper aims to extend the results of Yetter on the deformation theory of associative algebras and poset-indexed diagrams to arbitrary pasting diagrams of @xmath0-linear categories, @xmath0-linear functors, and natural transformations.
    *   The authors establish that obstructions are cocycles in a family of pasting diagrams sufficient to imply the result in general, and provide a detailed and rigorous exposition of a method developed heuristically by Shrestha.
*   The paper also discusses the cochain maps constructed in theorems 8.2 and 8.3, which depend on choices of association for 2-dimensional compositions in the pasting diagram.
    *   The authors show that these cochain maps are independent of those choices, up to algebraic homotopy, and thus the isomorphism type of the deformation complex for a pasting diagram is well-defined in either the homotopy category or derived category of cochain complexes over @xmath0.
*   The paper provides explicit examples of deformation complexes associated to various shapes of commutative pasting diagrams, and uses the cochain maps of the previous section to give these examples.
    *   The authors also discuss the relationship between the cohomological description of infinitesimal deformations and the evident expression of the same data in terms of systems of parallels and the various expressions given by labeling of (whiskered) polygons and tiled spheres.

<summary>

• The main goal of physics is not only to calculate observable quantities but to understand the underlying physical picture responsible for the phenomenon.
	• This involves selecting essential degrees of freedom and simplifying complex theories.
	• In the case of crystals, the fundamental degrees of freedom are ions, electrons, and the electromagnetic field, but for understanding electric conductivity and heat capacity, it is more effective to work with "heavy electrons," phonons, and their interactions.

• A similar situation occurs in QCD, where the full nonquenched QCD on the lattice is too complicated to solve directly.
	• However, the spontaneous breaking of chiral symmetry is the most important QCD phenomenon in this case, and beyond the scale of spontaneous breaking, light and strange baryons can be viewed as systems of three constituent quarks interacting through the exchange of goldstone bosons, vector, and scalar mesons.

• The chiral symmetry of the QCD Lagrangian is spontaneously broken down to a subgroup by the QCD vacuum.
	• A direct evidence for this is the nonzero value of the quark condensates for light flavors, which represent the order parameter.

• The spontaneous breaking of chiral symmetry has two important generic consequences: the appearance of the octet of pseudoscalar mesons of low mass and the acquisition of dynamical mass by valence quarks, known as constituent quarks.
	• The constituent quarks should be considered as quasiparticles with dynamical mass coming from nonperturbative gluon and quark-antiquark dressing.

• The chiral interaction between constituent quarks is crucial for understanding the baryon spectrum.
	• The interaction is explicitly flavor-dependent and produces a strong short-range spin-flavor force, which is essential for the ordering of the lowest positive and negative parity states in the baryon spectrum.

• The chiral constituent quark model provides a unified description of both nonstrange and strange baryon spectra in good agreement with phenomenology.
	• The model involves a total of 4 free parameters, which are determined from the fit to all 35 confirmed low-lying states.

• The chiral constituent quark model can also explain the short-range repulsion in the nn system.
	• The repulsion is induced by the same short-range part of the chiral interaction that produces hyperfine splittings in baryon spectroscopy.

</summary>

•  **Introduction to the Invention**
    • The invention relates to novel calcium phosphate-coated implantable medical devices and processes of making same, which minimize immune response to the implant and have the capability to store and release one or more medicinally active agents into the body in a controlled manner.

•  **Background of the Invention**
    • Cardiovascular stents are widely used in coronary angioplasty procedures to enlarge coronary arteries and thereby allow better blood circulation, but the placement of metallic stents often leads to harmful side effects such as inflammatory restenosis.

•  **Problem with Current Coatings**
    • The most common surface modification of implanted medical devices is the application of a thin polymer film coating, which is frequently impregnated with medically active agents, but these coatings are still recognized by living tissue as foreign objects and can cause an adverse response of the tissue.

•  **Advantages of Calcium Phosphate Coatings**
    • Calcium phosphate coatings, including hydroxyapatite (HA), are fully bio-compatible and bio-resorbable with no side effects, and can be designed with a high level of control of coating dissolution rate and microstructure, which also determine the drug retention and release characteristics.

•  **Methods of Coating Implantable Medical Devices**
    • The invention includes various methods of coating implantable medical devices with calcium phosphate coatings, including sol-gel (SG) process, electro-phoretic deposition (EPD) process, biomimetic deposition process, calcium phosphate cement deposition process, and electrochemical deposition process.

•  **Examples of Coating Implantable Medical Devices**
    • The invention includes various examples of coating implantable medical devices with calcium phosphate coatings, including stainless steel stents coated with discontinuous ASG-HA thin film, continuous EPD-HA thin film, and composite coatings of EPD-HA and sol-gel HA.

</summary>

<summary>

•  **Background and Problem Statement**
    • The present invention relates to the field of nerve regeneration, particularly to nerve conduits for the regeneration of peripheral nerves.

•  **Current Limitations of Nerve Repair**
    • Current treatments for nerve repair, such as end-to-end suturing and autograft or allograft biological tissue, have limitations, including potential donor site morbidity and immunogenicity.

•  **Advances in Tissue Engineering and Biomaterials**
    • Recent advances in tissue engineering and biomaterials suggest alternative approaches to nerve repair and regeneration, including the use of biomaterials to produce natural or synthetic nerve guidance conduits (NGCs).

•  **Design of Optimal NGCs**
    • The design of an optimal NGC for enhancing peripheral nerve regeneration (PNR) remains a challenge, as current NGCs have limitations, including insufficient cross-sectional area and inadequate design of intra-luminal guidance channels/filament.

•  **Embodiments of the Present Invention**
    • An embodiment of the present invention provides a fabricated implantable NGC comprising an inner spiral structured porous sheet, which has the potential to serve as a medical device to treat peripheral nerve injuries (PNI) and restore function to the site of the injury.

•  **Features of the NGC**
    • The NGC has several features, including a three-dimensional (3-D) integrated spiral structured porous sheet with proximal and distal reserved chambers, decorated surface channels on the spiral porous sheet with additional electrospun aligned fibers, and an outer fibrous tube.

•  **Fabrication Method**
    • A method of fabricating an NGC according to an embodiment of the present invention involves fabricating a polycaprolactone (PCL) sheet using a combination of the solvent evaporation method and the salt-leaching method.

•  **Properties of the NGCs**
    • The NGCs have several properties, including superior mechanical strength, high surface/volume ratios, and good inter-cell communication, which are important for nerve regeneration.

•  **Biological Evaluation**
    • The NGCs were tested in a 10 mm Sprague Dawley (SD) rat sciatic nerve defect to evaluate the effect of nanofibers on peripheral nerve regeneration through porous spiral NGCs, and the results showed that the NGCs with nanofibers had better nerve regeneration and functional recovery compared to the NGCs without nanofibers.

</summary>

<summary>
*   **Introduction to the Invention**
    *   The invention is related to seat base support assemblies, particularly for furniture, and aims to provide a new and improved rail connector for sinuous spring bands, wire grids, chord-rubber webbing, and flexible steel bands.
*   **Background of the Invention**
    *   The industry's need for deep-drop uplift at the back rail was met by furniture seat spring torsioning devices, but these devices became expensive, leading to the use of SWING ANCHOR connecting links and radius links.
*   **Problem Statement**
    *   The use of thicker cushions and lower seat frame heights created a need for more upward resilience in the spring base.
*   **Objectives of the Invention**
    *   The invention aims to provide a rail connector that embodies the salutary features of conventional helical spring connectors while retaining none of the undesirable features.
*   **Description of the Invention**
    *   The invention includes two forms of rail connectors: a first form using pre-stressed, close-wound coil springs with attachment arms and a second form using a pre-stressed, cantilever spring configuration.
*   **Advantages of the Invention**
    *   The invention provides seat spring-enhancing connectors that combine four essential seat-force-generators: torsioning, dynamic uplift, expansion-contraction, and leverage-amplification, resulting in four desired seat-performance characteristics.
</summary>

•  The present disclosure is directed to an anvil assembly for use with a surgical stapling device, particularly a circular surgical stapling device.
    •  The anvil assembly includes an anvil shaft with a proximal portion and a distal portion, and a stabilizing collet positioned within the anvil shaft to prevent damage to the anvil shaft.
•  The anvil shaft includes a plurality of flexible legs that define a longitudinal bore, and the collet is received within the longitudinal bore to support the flexible legs.
    •  The collet is secured within the longitudinal bore by a plurality of cantilevered fingers that engage with holes formed in the anvil shaft.
•  The anvil assembly is designed to facilitate reliable attachment to a stapling device, particularly in situations where visibility is limited.
    •  The collet is positioned to prevent damage to the anvil shaft caused by engagement with a grasper, and to allow the anvil assembly to be readily connected to the stapling device.
•  The anvil assembly includes an anvil head assembly that supports an anvil plate with staple deforming pockets, and a cut ring assembly.
    •  The anvil head assembly is pivotally or fixedly attached to the anvil shaft, and the anvil plate is annular in configuration.
•  The anvil shaft includes a tubular portion and a plurality of flexible legs that extend proximally from the tubular portion.
    •  Each of the flexible legs defines a longitudinal channel with an adjacent leg, and includes a hole formed at the distal end of the longitudinal channel.
</summary>

<summary>
*   **Garnish Pick Design**
    \t*   The garnish pick includes one or more appendages that can serve as skewering shafts or hooks to secure the pick to a food or beverage container.
    \t*   The appendages can project from a main shaft at various angles and orientations, simulating the appearance of an organism or a portion thereof.
    \t*   The garnish pick can have a curved or tapered main shaft, and the appendages can be made of different materials or have different shapes and sizes.
*   **Advantages of the Garnish Pick**
    \t*   The garnish pick can be hooked to the side of a glass, preventing it from becoming completely or further submerged in a beverage.
    \t*   The pick provides additional shafts for holding garnishes, making it easier to eat them off the pick without using fingers.
    \t*   The garnish pick eliminates the need to retrieve the pick out of the beverage or container with fingers.
*   **Variations of the Garnish Pick**
    \t*   The garnish pick can have multiple appendages, each serving as a skewering shaft or hook, and can be made of different materials or have different shapes and sizes.
    \t*   The pick can have a forked main shaft, forming two skewering shafts, or a curved main shaft with multiple appendages.
    \t*   The garnish pick can be designed to resemble a twig or branch of a tree or plant, or have a contoured shape to fit a specific beverage container.
*   **Example Garnish Pick Designs**
    \t*   The garnish pick can have a pick body with a first elongate body portion forming a hook and a second elongate body portion forming a tapered skewer.
    \t*   The pick body can have a third elongate body portion branching from the first elongate body portion, forming a third tapered skewer.
    \t*   The garnish pick can have a core formed from a first material and an outer coating formed from a second material, and can be asymmetric about any plane passing through the pick.
</summary>

<summary>
•  **Cardiac Assist System Overview**
	• The present invention relates to a cardiac assist system that combines a cardiomyostimulator and a cardiac pacer-cardioverter-defibrillator for treating patients with cardiac output deficiencies.
•  **Problem Statement**
	• Current cardiac assist systems have limitations, such as interference between muscle stimulation and cardiac event sensing, leading to unreliable arrhythmia detection.
•  **Invention Description**
	• The present invention employs a sensor to monitor cardiac electrical activity and cardiac demand in a skeletal muscle-powered cardiac assist system.
•  **System Components**
	• The system includes a pulse generator, a skeletal muscle graft, and a lead for electrical stimulation and sensing of the heart.
•  **Algorithm and Detection**
	• The system uses a detection algorithm to identify arrhythmias, such as ventricular fibrillation and tachycardia, and delivers appropriate therapy, including muscle stimulation, cardiac pacing, cardioversion, and defibrillation.

    • Introduction to the invention
        • The invention is a continuation-in-part of a prior application Ser. No. 07/589,995.
        • The invention relates to esophageal electrodes and their use in medical procedures.
        • The invention aims to improve the efficiency of procedures such as pacing and defibrillation.
        • The invention is directed to an esophageal-stomach electrode.

    • Background of the invention
        • Esophageal electrodes are used in medical procedures such as defibrillating and pacing the heart.
        • The use of esophageal electrodes can be enhanced by positioning the electrode close to the organ being treated.
        • Prior art includes patents and applications that disclose methods and apparatus for using internal, noninvasive esophageal electrodes.
        • The prior art includes techniques for positioning the electrode close to the ventricle of the heart.

    • Description of the invention
        • The invention includes a semi-rigid plastic tube with an electrode on the distal end.
        • The tube is crimped to form a hinge, allowing it to bend readily at that point.
        • A rigid pin is disposed in the tube, extending generally parallel to the tube axis.
        • A pair of cords are connected to the proximal and distal ends of the pin, extending proximally in the tube.

    • Operation of the invention
        • The tube is inserted into the esophagus and into the stomach.
        • The distal end of the tube is displaced angularly within the stomach.
        • The electrode is positioned close to the ventricle of the heart by displacing the stomach wall.
        • The electrode is prevented from further displacement by resistance of the stomach wall.

    • Control mechanism
        • The control mechanism includes a sleeve and a slide.
        • The slide is connected to the cords, allowing the operator to control the displacement of the tube.
        • The slide is moved to the right to cause the pin to move downwardly in the tube.
        • The slide is moved back to the left to relieve the tension on the cord and allow the tube to return to its original position.

    • Advantages of the invention
        • The invention provides a convenient means of enabling an operator to place the esophageal stomach displacement electrode close to the heart.
        • The invention reduces the energy required to carry out procedures such as pacing or defibrillation.
        • The invention is a noninvasive procedure.

•  **Game Overview**
	• The game is a board game that simulates life at a lake, where players can acquire, sell, mortgage, and improve properties such as lake areas, dams, and boat dealerships.
• **Game Components**
	• The game includes a game board, tokens, title deed cards, scrip money, Makin A Wake cards, and Sunken Chest cards.
• **Gameplay**
	• Players move their tokens around the board, purchasing properties and paying rental fees to other players who own them.
	• Players can also draw Makin A Wake or Sunken Chest cards, which can provide benefits or penalties.
• **Property Improvement**
	• Players can improve their lake areas by erecting lake cabins and marinas, which can increase rental fees.
	• However, players must pay a mortgage amount to the Bank to improve their properties.
• **Game End**
	• The game ends when all but one player is bankrupt, and the remaining player is declared the winner.
• **Winning Conditions**
	• The game can be won by being the last player remaining, or by accumulating a certain amount of wealth or properties.
</summary>

*   **Introduction to the Problem**
    *   *   Patients with open wounds that cannot be sutured edge to edge constitute a major health problem.
    *   *   Such wounds tend to become chronic due to poor blood supply, infection, and dehydration.
    *   *   Non-surgical treatment is usually followed by reconstructive surgery using skin grafts, composite tissue transfers, or tissue regeneration.

*   **Current Solutions and Limitations**
    *   *   Occlusive, pliable film dressings prevent dehydration and facilitate healing in superficial open wounds.
    *   *   Active dressings permitting saline or therapeutic agent supply and/or suctioning improve healing in deeper wounds.
    *   *   Known open pore dressings lack reliable intermittent administration of saline or drug solution during ongoing suctioning.

*   **Invention Overview**
    *   *   The invention eliminates or minimizes positive hydrostatic or pump pressure for supplying fluid to the dressing.
    *   *   Treatment fluid is sucked through the dressing pores by the suction pump used for distributing negative pressure to the wound.
    *   *   The fluid reservoir is placed on a support with a sloping or horizontal surface, eliminating hydrostatic pressure.

*   **Apparatus and Method**
    *   *   The apparatus includes a fluid administration set with a drip chamber and angulated entry channel.
    *   *   The set may include a horizontal level meter and injection port for adding a drug dose during ongoing supply and suctioning.
    *   *   The apparatus also includes a supply port with an elastic injection membrane for intermittent fluid administration.

*   **Drainage Port and Bleeding Detection**
    *   *   The drainage port includes an open grid to prevent occlusion of the underlying open pores of the pad.
    *   *   The apparatus for detecting bleeding from a wound during continuous suctioning treatment includes a receptacle, scale, canister, movement buffer organs, computer, visual display, audible alarm, and telemetry.
    *   *   The method for detecting bleeding involves determining the baseline rate and variability of therapeutic fluid formation and giving an alarm once bleeding is detected.

*   **Tissue Regeneration**
    *   *   The invention allows for tissue regeneration by minimizing hydrostatic pressure and suction at the drainage port.
    *   *   The fluid supply rates and loading doses for filling the dressing with drug solution are controlled to leave diffusional and cellular processes undisturbed.

<summary>
*   The present invention relates to imaging, specifically to an imaging method and apparatus employing Radial Reflection Diffraction Tomography (RRDT). 
    *   The RRDT technique is based on a linearized scattering model and uses a Hilbert space inverse wave (HSIW) algorithm to form images of a medium surrounding a physical probe in a plane perpendicular to an axis of rotation.
*   The invention can be used for various applications, including characterizing plaque in arteries, determining the state of buried wastes, and tracking plumes of underground contaminants.
    *   The RRDT method and apparatus can be combined with elastography to gain further insight into a surrounding medium's elastic properties and provide further information in the determination of characterizing plaque as vulnerable or stable.
    *   The invention can also be used for non-destructive characterization in applications other than for intravascular RRDT imaging, such as characterizing underground contamination plumes or waste in contamination barrels.
</summary>

<summary>
•  The invention concerns a biological oil composition derived from a marine copepod, preferably of the genus Calanus, such as Calanus finmarchicus. 
    •  The oil composition is rich in eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA), but differs from other marine oils in its chemical composition, including a high content of stearidonic acid (SDA) and wax esters.

•  The oil composition has been found to have a statistically significant ability to inhibit the formation of atherosclerotic plaques and to reduce total blood cholesterol levels in experimental animals.
    •  The effects of the oil composition are distinct from those of concentrated EPA and DHA, suggesting that the mechanisms involved may be additive or entirely different.

•  The oil composition is suitable for use as a medicament for the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular disease, atherosclerosis, hypercholesterolaemia, and elevated blood cholesterol levels.
    •  The composition may be administered orally in a daily dosage level of 4-100 mg/kg body weight, and may be formulated as a dietary supplement, functional food, or pharmaceutical product.

•  The oil composition may be produced by any method known to the person skilled in the art, including conventional fish oil production technology, biotechnological methods, organic solvents, or supercritical fluid extraction.
    •  The composition may be isolated from a marine copepod, preferably of the genus Calanus, and may be formulated with one or more pharmaceutically acceptable additives.
</summary>

*   The invention is a golf ball teeing device that allows a golfer to tee up a golf ball without bending over.
    *   The device is attached to a golf club grip and uses a delayed urging means to clamp the ball and tee in place.
    *   The delayed urging means is a low-recovery foam that compresses and then slowly rebounds, allowing the golfer to easily remove the device from the ball and tee.
    *   The device is lightweight and portable, making it easy to carry in a golf bag or clip to a golfer's apparel.

*   The device has several advantages over prior teeing devices.
    *   It eliminates the need for a handle-mounted unclamping control, making it easier to use and more convenient.
    *   It allows the golfer to use a golf club as the handle, reducing the weight and size of the device.
    *   It is simple to use, with no cumbersome controls to release the tee and ball.
    *   It can be easily attached to a golf bag or clipped to a golfer's apparel.

*   The device can be used to retrieve a golf tee from the ground without bending over.
    *   The golfer can use the golf club as a long handle to maneuver the device under the tee.
    *   The device can be used to scoop up a tee that has come out of the ground while hitting the ball.
    *   The device can be easily removed from the tee and reused to tee up another ball.

*   The device has a number of features that make it convenient and easy to use.
    *   It has a clip that allows it to be attached to a golf bag or clipped to a golfer's apparel.
    *   It has a slot that allows it to be used to scoop up a tee that has come out of the ground.
    *   It has a delayed urging means that allows it to be easily removed from the ball and tee.
    *   It is lightweight and portable, making it easy to carry in a golf bag.

*   **Introduction to the Invention**
    *   The invention is a skin reflectance measuring apparatus.
    *   It is a continuation of a previous application.
    *   The invention is useful in pathology and cosmetology.
    *   It can measure the reflectance of skin and other parameters.

*   **Problem to be Solved**
    *   The known devices for measuring surface reflectance are not applicable to skin reflectance.
    *   The influence of color is a major problem.
    *   The known devices using relative measurement between specular reflection and diffuse reflection are inappropriate for measuring skin reflectance.
    *   The apparatuses used in industry require accurate positioning of the measuring apparatus.

*   **Object of the Invention**
    *   The object of the invention is to propose a reflectance measurement apparatus specifically adapted for measuring the reflectance of the skin.
    *   The apparatus should be easy to handle and require no high accurate positioning with respect to the skin.
    *   The apparatus should be able to measure the reflectance of small surfaces.
    *   The apparatus should be able to tolerate a few degrees of deviation of relative position between the probe and the skin surface.

*   **Structure of the Measuring Apparatus**
    *   The apparatus comprises a probe, a measuring device, and a flexible connection in fiber optics.
    *   The probe is designed to be placed in contact with the skin.
    *   The measuring device comprises light emitting means, light receiving means, and processing means.
    *   The processing means are connected to the light emitting and receiving means and are provided with correcting means.

*   **Advantages of the Invention**
    *   The use of fiber optics having their ends secured inside the casing of the probe permits the miniaturization of the probe.
    *   The probe can be small and has no optical elements such as lenses which require high positioning accuracy.
    *   The measuring area can be small enough to allow significant measurements over a surface with as little rigidity and uniformity as the skin.
    *   The apparatus is easy to handle and requires no high accurate positioning with respect to the skin.

*   **Calibration of the Apparatus**
    *   The calibration of the apparatus is performed by placing the probe before a light trap, a matt surface of reference, and a calibrated mirror.
    *   The values of ΦSs, ΦDs, K, and SC are determined by calibration.

*   The invention is a dental cleaning and massaging apparatus that provides a relatively simple and highly effective means for cleaning teeth and the gingival crevices and for massaging the gums.
    *   The apparatus comprises a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members that fit over the upper and lower teeth, respectively, and fit snugly against the respective gums.
    *   The mouthpiece is designed to provide a massaging action on the gums by inflating and deflating air-sacks that are integrated into the hose or tube connecting the upper and lower channel members.
*   The apparatus uses hydraulic means to clean the teeth and gingival crevices and to lubricate the gums during massaging.
    *   A source of water is provided to control box 22 by means of the hose 26, which can be mixed with a cleaning fluid stored inside of control box 22.
    *   The fluid drawn out of the mouth around mouthpiece 1 through hoses 19 and 20 is drained out of control box 22 by means of hose 27.
*   The apparatus can be operated in three modes: providing both air and water, providing air only, or providing water only.
    *   Control box 22 is provided with three ON-OFF switches to provide the three modes of operation.
    *   A remote control device 28 is preferably provided to allow the user to control the apparatus from a convenient location.
*   The apparatus can be modified to include additional features, such as bristles on the upper and lower channels to assist the massaging action.
    *   A single coupling arrangement could be used to couple the control panel to the mouthpiece.
    *   The entire hose or tube could be made of the same material as air-sacks, allowing for more flexibility in design.
*   The apparatus is designed to be easy to use and maintain, with a simple and intuitive control system.
    *   The control box 22 is provided with a remote control device 28 that is sized and shaped to be conveniently held in the hand of the user.
    *   The apparatus can be used interchangeably with a plurality of mouthpieces, making it a convenient and versatile tool for dental care.
</summary>

    *  The invention provides a needle for surgical threading of a strap of an implant through a tissue.

    *  The posterior implant may be used for reconstructing the organs selected from the group including the colon, the small intestine, and the uterus.

    *  The method further includes releasing the trap and returning the needle to the accessible side while abandoning the strap at the threaded point.

• **Introduction to the Invention**
	• The invention relates to methods and apparatus for providing ventilatory assistance matched to a subject's respiratory need.
	• The invention is especially suitable for spontaneously breathing human subjects requiring long-term ventilatory assistance, particularly during sleep.
	• The invention aims to address the goals of matching the phase and degree of assistance to the subject's spontaneous efforts, automatically adjusting the degree of assistance to maintain at least a specified minimum average ventilation, and providing some immunity to the effects of sudden leaks.

• **Background of the Invention**
	• Subjects with severe lung disease, chest wall disease, neuromuscular disease, or diseases of respiratory control may require in-hospital mechanical ventilatory assistance, followed by long-term home mechanical ventilatory assistance.
	• Most known ventilatory devices do not accurately match the amplitude and phase of mask pressure to the subject's spontaneous efforts, leading to discomfort or panic.
	• The invention aims to address the limitations of existing ventilatory devices and provide a more effective and comfortable solution for subjects requiring ventilatory assistance.

• **Goals of the Invention**
	• The invention aims to match the phase and degree of assistance to the subject's spontaneous efforts when ventilation is well above a target ventilation.
	• The invention aims to automatically adjust the degree of assistance to maintain at least a specified minimum average ventilation without relying on the integrity of the subject's chemoreflexes.
	• The invention aims to provide some immunity to the effects of sudden leaks.

• **Method for Calculating Instantaneous Phase**
	• The invention discloses a method for calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle as a continuous variable.
	• The method includes determining the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle from at least two identifiable features of a prototype flow-vs-time waveform.
	• The method uses fuzzy logic to determine the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle.

• **Method for Providing Ventilatory Assistance**
	• The invention discloses a method for providing ventilatory assistance in a spontaneously breathing subject.
	• The method includes ascribing a desired waveform template function and calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle.
	• The method uses the instantaneous phase to calculate the desired instantaneous delivery pressure and sets the delivered pressure to the subject.

• **Method for Calculating Instantaneous Inspired Volume**
	• The invention discloses a method for calculating the instantaneous inspired volume of a subject.
	• The method includes determining respiratory airflow approximately corrected for leak and calculating an index J varying from 0 to 1.

<summary>
•  The invention is an electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument for use in laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures.
    •  The instrument includes a rigid insulating sleeve and a conductive rod that extends from the plug end to the distal end.
•  The distal end of the instrument includes a rigid arm that extends from the sleeve and includes portions laterally offset from the longitudinal axis of the sleeve.
    •  The arm is used to space the working tip electrode from the sleeve, reducing obstruction of the surgeon's view of the operation site.
•  The instrument includes a thin layer of insulating material disposed upon the arm from the sleeve to the base of the working tip electrode.
    •  This prevents unintentional cauterization with portions of the instrument other than the working tip electrode.
•  The working tip electrode comes in various shapes, including a hook and a flattened spatula, depending on the needs of the surgeon.
    •  The shape of the working tip electrode is used for specific functions, such as pulling at tissue or cauterizing bleeding blood vessels.
•  The instrument is designed for easy handling and use by the surgeon, and is suitable for use in both laparoscopic and open surgeries.
    •  The instrument is also designed to be a single-use, disposable device.
</summary>

<summary>
•  The invention is related to a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) apparatus that allows for high-contrast exposures in a short time, even for larger body segments.
  •  The apparatus has a magnet, a patient receptacle, a support plate, and a predetermined number of transmit and/or receive coils.
•  In known MRI apparatuses, exposure parameters must be modified for different exposure positions, which requires a readjustment of the apparatus.
  •  This readjustment can take 10 to 90 seconds per exposure position, which is not available for certain examination procedures.
•  The inventive solution determines the required adjustment parameters in a preceding adjustment process and stores them in a memory until the conclusion of the examination.
  •  The adjustment parameters include the position of the support plate, the configuration of the transmit and/or receive coils, and control signals for the generator, amplifiers, and receiver.
•  The apparatus has a support plate that is longitudinally displaceable inside the examination volume of the magnet.
  •  The longitudinal displaceability of the support plate allows for the examination of larger body sections of a patient.
•  The inventive apparatus is suitable for a large number of different forms of MRI apparatuses, including cylindrical and horseshoe magnets.
  •  The apparatus can be used for examinations such as tracking doses of contrast agent over a larger body region.
•  The inventive solution allows for high-contrast exposures without omitting an adjustment, resulting in reduced examination times.
  •  This enables the tracking of the contrast agent course without chronological gaps in subtraction angiography.
•  The adjustment parameters are stored in a memory until the conclusion of the examination, allowing for quick switching of the transmit and receive coils during the examination.
  •  This results in reduced examination times and high-contrast exposures.
</summary>

<summary>
*   The invention relates to a fastener for albums, such as photographic albums and scrapbooks, that allows for easy addition or replacement of album pages.
    *   The fastener consists of a pair of strap anchors, one attached to the front cover and the other to the back cover, and a strap that passes through aligned apertures in the covers and album pages.
*   The strap anchors are in the form of channels with snap locks that allow the strap to be easily inserted and removed.
    *   The strap has parallel ribs that engage with the ribs on the base of the channel to prevent longitudinal movement.
*   The strap anchors are attached to the covers using adhesive, such as double-sided tape.
    *   Positive alignment is achieved between the aperture in the base of the channel and the hole in the adjacent cover using lugs.
*   The strap is of a semi-rigid plastics material that allows for flexibility and rigidity.
    *   The strap can be easily inserted through the aligned holes in the covers and album pages, and its rigidity helps to align the holes if they are slightly misaligned.
*   The fastener provides a releasable connection between the strap and each strap anchor, allowing for adjustment of the effective length of the strap.
    *   This allows for the addition of additional sets of album pages without the need for complex fastening systems.
*   The fastener is designed to be inexpensive to produce and maintain a cost comparable to conventional fastening screws.
    *   The simple design of the fastener also allows for a low profile, making it suitable for use in albums with conventional screw-type fasteners.
*   A modified embodiment of the invention includes saw-tooth profile ribs on the strap and channel, and additional ribs on the surface of the adjacent lug.
    *   This provides further improvement in the fixing of the strap in the channel to prevent slipping.
</summary>

<summary>
*   **Background and Problem**
    *  The invention relates to rotating water feeds and ventilation systems for water-cooled generators.
    *  Air bubbles in the cooling system can cause overheating and reduce efficiency.
    *  Prior art solutions, such as a long thin pipe extending from the branch point of the cooling water connections, require considerable engineering effort.

*   **Objectives of the Invention**
    *  The invention aims to provide an arrangement that avoids the disadvantages of prior art techniques.
    *  The invention aims to provide an automatic removal or reduction of air or gas bubbles accumulating in rotating pipes.
    *  The invention aims to formulate a structural arrangement that is as simple in design as possible.

*   **Summary of the Invention**
    *  The invention provides a ventilation system with at least one bypass having at least one inlet and at least one outlet.
    *  The bypass is arranged between the feed duct and the discharge duct of the apparatus.
    *  The bypass has at least one inlet that opens into the space around the axis of rotation of the apparatus.

*   **Advantages of the Invention**
    *  The invention provides a ventilation system that is relatively simple in its design and construction.
    *  The invention provides a ventilation system that is automatic and does not require manual operation.
    *  The invention provides a ventilation system that can be easily integrated into existing cooling systems.

*   **Preferred Embodiments of the Invention**
    *  The bypass can be arranged in or on an end face of the feed ducts.
    *  The bypass can be designed as a radially arranged pipe member with at least one inlet in the space around the axis of rotation.
    *  The bypass can be designed as a coiled pipe having at least one inlet opening into the space around the axis of rotation.

*   **Structural Arrangements for the Bypass**
    *  The bypass can include means for increasing the hydrodynamic resistance of flow through the bypass.
    *  The bypass can be arranged at any desired point of the inner pipe.
    *  The bypass can be provided with several inlets and outlets.
</summary>

*   The invention relates to a steering column for a motor vehicle, which comprises a jacket unit supporting a steering shaft rotatably about its longitudinal axis and a retaining part, which the jacket unit is secured non-displaceably up to a limit value of a force acting onto the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft in the direction toward the front of the motor vehicle.
    *   The jacket unit is connected with the retaining part, for one, across an energy absorption connection, which comprises at least one bending wire or strip that, upon a displacement of the jacket unit with respect to the retaining part parallel to the longitudinal direction toward the motor vehicle front, is deformed, and is connected, for another, across a break-away connection which, up to the limit value of the force, is closed and blocks a displacement of the jacket unit with respect to the retaining part and which is released if the limit value of the force is exceeded.
    *   The invention further relates to a method for the production of such a steering column.
*   The steering column is preferably implemented such that it is adjustable in length, and an openable and closable securement device is provided, in the opened state of which the jacket unit is displaceable with respect to a bracket unit supporting the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft.
    *   In the closed state of the securement device, a securement force is applied for the securement of the jacket unit with respect to the bracket unit against a displacement parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft.
    *   The retaining part is formed by a part of the securement device, and the retaining part in the closed state of the securement device is in engagement with a securement part which is secured in position with respect to the bracket unit such that it is nondisplaceable in the direction of the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft.
    *   The securement part and the retaining part come in different length settings of the steering column in different positions into mutual contact when the securement device is closed.
*   The break-away connection between the retaining part and the jacket unit can be formed, for example, by a pin connecting these two parts, which, in the event of a crash, is sheared off if the limit value of the force acting upon the steering shaft and thereover onto the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft in the direction toward the vehicle front is exceeded.

    • The present invention is a process for mounting flat, uncurved glass panels in curved window bays of motor vehicles.
        • This process aims to overcome the disadvantages of conventional pre-contoured and pre-stressed glass panels.
        • The conventional process involves expensive annealing and tempering processes, employing expensive molds.

    • The conventional process has several disadvantages, including distortion of the glass panel during tempering and contouring.
        • The glass panel becomes less flexible and more brittle, making it prone to shattering in vehicular accidents.
        • Pre-contoured glass panels are also more expensive and difficult to package for transportation and storage.

    • The present invention provides a method for installing flat, uncontoured glass panels in curved window bays.
        • The glass panel is flexed in situ to conform to the curved window bay.
        • The flexing of the glass panel produces an urgency to return to its flat shape, allowing for the application of adhesive sealant.

    • The fastening means for holding the glass panel in place consists of a combination of individual resilient clips and a reveal molding.
        • The clips are uniformly spaced about the perimeter of the window bay and are secured firmly in place.
        • The reveal molding is provided with a triangular-shaped head that snaps onto the leaf portion of each clip.

    • The reveal molding is urged inwardly and downwardly by the clips, causing the lower end to engage and press onto the face of the glass panel.
        • The lower end of the molding acts as a securing element, effecting and maintaining flexure of the glass panel.
        • A continuous band of weather stripping is secured to the inturned edge of the molding.

    • The permanent mounting of the glass panel is achieved using a curable adhesive sealant inserted in the compartment between the panel and the frame.
        • The adhesive sealant is inserted behind the peripheral edge of the flexed glass panel.
        • The adhesive sealant bonds with the confronting inner surface and peripheral edge of the glass panel.

    • A continuously extending dam of elastic material is placed to lodge along the inner wall of the frame adjacent the periphery of the window bay.
        • The dam acts as a closure for the continuous bead of adhesive sealant.
        • The flat uncontoured glass is held in place by engagement with the fastener means until the adhesive cures and bonds.

    • Conventional tempered or untempered flat glass panels can be employed in the present invention.

*   The invention is a mechanical, cylindrical gas scavenger machine that removes a gas from a liquid, particularly suited for use on floating offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms. 
    *   The machine has a vessel with a plurality of partitions dividing it into gasification chambers, each with a vapor space and a mechanism for ingesting and mixing a second gas into the liquid to displace the first gas.
*   The machine operates by introducing a continuous flow of liquid into the inlet chamber, where a flow of second gas is introduced into the liquid by gas ingesting and mixing mechanisms, creating a turbulent area and allowing the second gas to physically displace the first gas.

<summary>
•  The packaging machine described in the source document is a deep-drawing packaging machine that comprises a plurality of work stations which are operable in synchronism with one another.
	•  The work stations are arranged in succession in the production direction of the packaging machine, with each work station including at least one movable tool member.
•  The packaging machine is provided with a rotationally driven shaft arranged in the production direction of the packaging machine.
	•  The shaft drives the tool members of a plurality of work stations, automatically synchronizing their movements through the movement of the shaft.
•  The transfer mechanism comprises an arrangement of toggle levers and/or a cam mechanism for converting the movement of the shaft into the movement of the respective tool member.
	•  The transfer mechanism is rendered robust and independent of high-wear components, such as a belt.
•  The shaft may be driven in a continuous 360° rotation or alternately in different directions of rotation.
	•  Alternating tool-member lifting movements are desired to be caused by the shaft in the latter case.
•  Work stations of the packaging machine whose tool members are driven by means of the shaft so as to execute a lifting movement may be a forming station, a sealing station, and/or a separating or cutting station.
	•  The packaging machine may also comprise a plurality of work stations of one of the above-mentioned types.
•  At least two work stations of the packaging machine are arranged on different vertical levels in one variant of the packaging machine.
	•  This allows the work stations to be arranged more closely to one another in the horizontal direction, resulting in a more compact structural design.
•  The packaging machine can be modified in many respects, including providing further work stations and/or driving further tool members of the existing work stations by means of the common shaft.
	•  The tools can be implemented as replaceable components, and the media connections can be easily releasable.
</summary>

    • The invention is a disposable finishing article drive member assembly that securely holds the article during operation.
        • It is designed to be light in weight, vibration-free, and less expensive than prior art throw-away articles.

    • The assembly includes a backing flange that is permanently affixed to the grinding wheel without the use of adhesives.
        • The backing flange has a diameter less than the diameter of the wheel and defines a second central aperture.

    • A retaining nut is inserted through the aperture in the grinding wheel and the aperture in the flange.
        • The nut is upset to provide a protrusion that secures the nut and the backing flange together on the wheel.

    • A pressure cap is snapped into locking engagement with the hub assembly to provide operational compressive forces.
        • The pressure cap includes a gripping rib that snaps over the fingers of the backing flange.

    • The assembly requires no adhesive for construction and may be simply and easily assembled.
        • It provides a secure attachment of the abrasive finishing article to the power tool.

    • The utilization of the device is extremely smooth in operation with no vibration.
        • The reason for such smooth operation is that all of the parts are perfectly aligned one with the other.

    • The assembly can accommodate all currently known sizes of standard diameter depressed center grinding wheels.
        • It meets all safety standards currently known and in existence.

    • The assembly is less expensive than prior art throw-away articles.
        • It is designed to be light in weight and vibration-free.

    • The assembly includes a radially outwardly directed gripping rib that snaps into engagement with a plurality of radially inwardly directed fingers.
        • The gripping rib assists in placing the finishing article in compression.
</summary>

<summary>
*   The invention is based on a generic hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system, which includes a housing block, a motor, a housing, and a covering hood. The unit has a cam element chamber, where pressure fluid is collected and stored in spring chambers.
    *   The pressure fluid is collected in the spring chambers, far from electrical components, and is then equalized with the atmosphere through a pressure equalization conduit.
    *   The pressure equalization conduit is formed by interstices between wires of a cable and a tubular cable sheath, which sheathes the wires.
*   The invention provides a cost-effective solution by utilizing the same conduit portions for pressure fluid collection and pressure equalization.
    *   The conduit portions are used in two ways, providing a pressure equilibrium between the spring chambers and the interior of the motor.
    *   This solution eliminates the need for separate conduits, resulting in cost savings.
*   The invention also provides a hermetic seal of the unit from the environment, allowing the housing block to be immersed and submerged without risk of damage.
    *   The hermetic seal is achieved through the use of a sealing element, which is made from an initially liquid sealing material such as silicone rubber.
    *   The sealing element is poured or sprayed onto the securing face of the housing block, creating a tight seal.
</summary>

<summary>
*   The invention relates to a power and free conveyor system that allows for the transfer of carriers from one predetermined path to another.
    *   The system includes a third dog that is normally urged to an operative carrier pushing position but is held by the track out of operative position.
*   The third dog is selectively operable and can be used to transfer across short or long distances, accommodating various systems with different transfer requirements.
    *   The system can be operated by moving the dogs upwardly simultaneously or sequentially, depending on the desired transfer distance and other factors.
*   The invention provides a power and free conveyor system that achieves transfer in a minimum period of time with minimum cost and maintenance.
    *   The system can be modified to accommodate different transfer distances and requirements, making it a versatile solution for various applications.

•  The invention is a grounding product for railroad car center plate assembly bowl liners of the all polymeric type.
    •  The liner is made of ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) with a conductive material additive, such as 2% carbon black.
    •  The liner has improved electrical properties and is conductive, eliminating the need for additional grounding apparatus.
    •  The liner is designed to withstand loads imposed by cars with a mass bearing on each center bowl on the order of 25,000 to 122,000 pounds.

•  The liner has several benefits, including self-lubricating properties, wear resistance, and resistance to compression, deterioration, and disintegration.
    •  The liner is pliable but non-stretchable and has a high degree of elastic memory for full return to original shape after being stressed.
    •  The liner is also conductive, made from ultra high molecular weight polyethylene specially mixed with a conductive material such as 2% carbon black.
    •  The liner's configuration is designed to fit in the space between the truck bolster bowl and the body bolster center plate to limit lost motion movement of the center plate relative to the bowl.

•  The liner has several embodiments, including a full bowl liner and a flat horizontal disk.
    •  The full bowl liner has a floor or disc portion and an upstanding wall that terminates in a flange.
    •  The flat horizontal disk has a peripheral edge that is sized to fit inside a metal collar style wear liner fitted to a truck bolster.
    •  The flat disk can also be made with a more concentrated inner conductive ring.

•  The liner provides several advantages, including improved electrical conductivity and a lower coefficient of friction.
    •  The liner meets the electrical conductivity standards of 1×10 5  ohms (100 Kohms) and has a coefficient of friction of 0.15 to 0.20.
    •  The liner also forms two slip surfaces with the center plate assembly to insure the needed swivelling action of the car trucks with respect to the car body.
    •  The liner's configuration provides a seal about the center plate neck portion that precludes entry of foreign material between the liner and center plate.

•  The invention is an improvement over both the all UHMW-PE liner and the clip or shunt grounded version.
    •  The all UHMW-PE liner has a high resistance,

• The invention is a gate valve used for controlling the bulk dispensing of viscous substances.
  •tab• The valve is designed to be operated with one hand while holding the receiving vessel with the other hand.
• The prior art provides two types of valves: rotatable cylindrical tube type and ball-type, both of which have limitations.
  •tab• The rotatable cylindrical tube type cannot be disassembled for cleaning and allows for residue accumulation.
  •tab• The ball-type valve also cannot be disassembled for cleaning and allows for residue accumulation.
• The present invention provides a gate valve that can be mounted on the spout of a bag or pouch.
  •tab• The valve includes a tubular sleeve with a dispensing package extending through it.
• The valve assembly comprises a spout insert mounting sleeve with a passage and a discharge outlet.
  •tab• The sleeve has a curved transversely relative to the axis of the sleeve to facilitate sealing.
• The gate valve member is reciprocated on the guide member relative to the sleeve.
  •tab• The gate valve member has a curved transversely complementally to the curvature of the guide plate.
• The valve can be disassembled for cleaning and reassembled easily.
  •tab• The valve can be actuated with one hand only and can function in an inclined position.
• The valve assembly can be mounted on the spout of a bag or pouch.
  •tab• The valve assembly can be used in a dispenser with a vertical slot that receives the spout of the bag.
</summary>

<summary>
•  The invention provides a vehicle rearview mirror system that can be used with various types of vehicles with modifications to the circuit.
    •  The system includes a variable reflective element that assumes a partial reflectance level in response to a drive signal.
    •  The system also includes a mirror control that is responsive to the output of the vehicle control for generating at least one mirror control output.
    •  The mirror control determines the protocol of the output of the vehicle control, including monitoring the output of the vehicle control in attempting to conclude a state of the output of the vehicle control.

•  The invention uses a software-based protocol determining technique to determine the protocol of the output of the vehicle control.
    •  The technique uses a logical sequence of events to determine the protocol, including monitoring the reverse input port and determining whether the port is high or low.
    •  The technique also uses a running average parameter that is repeatedly adjusted as the vehicle is operated to ensure that a proper protocol has been ascertained.
    •  The technique can continue to maintain the running average throughout the life of the vehicle to ensure that a proper protocol has been ascertained.
</summary>

*   The anti-lock braking system for motorcycles described in the source document includes an anti-dive device with a damped telescopic front suspension. 
    *   The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel, and cooperation may be achieved by tapping hydraulic pressure downstream of the anti-lock control unit or by sensing and applying the actual reaction to braking force of the front wheel.
    *   The system includes a hydraulic pump, a modulator, and a pressure discharge valve, which work together to control the hydraulic pressure applied to the front wheel brakes.
    *   The system also includes a sensor that detects the nearly-locked condition of the front wheel and opens the pressure discharge valve to reduce the hydraulic pressure and prevent the front wheel from locking.
*   The system includes an anti-dive unit that controls the contracting action of the telescopic front fork in accordance with the operation of the front wheel brake.
    *   The anti-dive unit is provided on the front wheel-supporting front fork and includes a piston that moves in response to the braking torque applied to the brake caliper.
    *   When the front wheel brake is applied, the piston moves forward to close an oil passage, which increases the damping force and restricts the contracting action of the front fork.
    *   The anti-dive unit suppresses the vertical vibration of the chassis, facilitates front wheel braking, and minimizes variations in the angular deceleration of the front wheel.
</summary>

    *   The invention is a movable partition system for refrigerated trailers, railcars, and containers.
        *   The system allows for the division of cargo space into sections of varying sizes.
        *   It enables the separation of cargo areas for multi-temperature transport.
        *   The system can be used to separate fresh food products from frozen or dry goods.
        *   It can also be used to minimize the volume of air that needs to be temperature-controlled.

    *   The partition system consists of at least two panels that are independently attached to one or more mounting assemblies.
        *   Each panel can be moved independently to define different cargo areas.
        *   The panels can be slidably attached to ceiling-mounted rails in a refrigerated trailer.
        *   They can also be hingedly attached to trolley assemblies and slidably attached to rails.

    *   The panels can be raised and lowered with a minimum of fore and aft clearance.
        *   They can be secured to the ceiling when not in use.
        *   The panels can be moved in the fore and aft direction.
        *   They can be "raised" like garage doors and secured to the ceiling.

    *   The system includes a rail assembly that consists of longitudinal rails and end rails.
        *   The longitudinal rails have an internal channel adapted to receive a slidable member.

<summary>

•  The invention is a sanitizable rotary valve for use in liquid chromatography and sanitary liquid handling systems.
    •  The valve has a rotor with a thermoplastic elastomeric diaphragm that is integrally molded to form multiple sealing ports.
    •  The diaphragm has dynamic wipe sealing lips that maintain fluid-tight sealing engagement with the stator face.
    •  The valve allows for sanitizing in place (SIP) without disassembling the valve.

•  The valve has a stator with connecting ports and ducts for all fluids entering and leaving the valve.
    •  The stator has make-before-break grooves that prevent unswept stagnant fluid volume in the process flowpath.
    •  The stator has barrier fluid flow paths that clean the inner side of the port sealing ledges.
    •  The stator has secondary containment means for any liquid escaping under the rotor diaphragm.

•  The valve has a rotor drive slot that engages with an actuator rotating flats to rotate the rotor.
    •  The rotor has first and second rotor sealing ports that move while remaining in sliding sealing engagement with the stator.
    •  The rotor has an elastomeric diaphragm that is integrally molded to form multiple sealing ports.
    •  The rotor has dynamic wipe sealing lips that maintain fluid-tight sealing engagement with the stator face.

•  The valve has a preferred application in liquid chromatography for separating solutes dissolved in a flowing solvent.
    •  The valve is used in simulated moving bed chromatography for fractionation of hydrocarbons and other substances.
    •  The valve allows for counter-current movement of the fluid ports to simulate counter-current movement of the bed.
    •  The valve has a complex rotary valve to move feed and eluent inlets and raffinate and extract outlets cyclically.

•  The valve has a specific application in a 12-bed rotating carousel arrangement for separating slow and fast components.
    •  The valve has two inputs (eluent, feed) and two outputs (raffinate, extract) with a substantial portion of the eluent being recycled.
    •  The valve has a flow rates of the inputs and outputs controlled by pumps relative to the switching rate of the beds.
    •  The valve creates separations in each zone by controlling the flow rates of the inputs and outputs.
</summary>

<summary>

*   The invention is a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating a fluid pressure.
    *   The assembly reduces variances in an output pressure as the result of large differences in input pressure.
    *   It is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain.
    *   It is lightweight and portable.
*   The assembly reduces the size and cost of a regulator needed to regulate the pressure of a fluid.
    *   It uses a vane motor to convert pressurized fluid into mechanical power.
    *   The mechanical power can be converted into rotational and/or electrical energy.
*   The vane motor is a key component of the assembly.
    *   It is a type of motor that uses fluid pressure to drive a shaft.
    *   The motor can be used to generate electricity or provide mechanical power.
*   The assembly can be used in various applications.
    *   It can be used in gas grills, self-contained underwater breathing apparatuses, and medical applications.
    *   It can be used to power appliances or provide mechanical work.
*   The assembly has several advantages.
    *   It extracts work from the pressurized fluid while reducing the pressure of the fluid.
    *   It allows the use of a smaller or more inexpensive pressure regulator.
    *   It can be used in conjunction with any number of regulators to recover work from a pressurized fluid.
*   The assembly can be modified and improved.
    *   Any desired motor can be used, including a standard turbine or piston motor.
    *   Any type of generator can be utilized, including both direct current and alternating current generators.
    *   The motor and generator can be of any desired dimensions and design.
*   The assembly has a wide range of potential applications.
    *   It can be used in vehicles driven by pressurized flammable fluids.
    *   It can be used in scuba diving equipment.
    *   It can be used in various industrial and commercial applications.

*   **Pallet System Overview**
    *   The invention features a pallet system that facilitates loading and unloading, and limits the shifting of loaded items.
    *   The pallet system includes a pallet with raised parallel guide rails that help position and interlock trays.
*   **Key Components**
    *   The pallet cap has raised parallel guide rails that are sized and spaced to straddle tray side supports, constraining lateral movement.
    *   End plates are positioned at the front and back ends of the pallet to secure the load of trays and protect the ends of the trays.
*   **Loading and Unloading**
    *   Trays are loaded onto the pallet by sliding them over a pair of guide rails from the front end towards the back end.
    *   The opposite action is used to unload trays from the pallet, with optional end stops limiting longitudinal movement.
*   **Customization and Variations**
    *   The pallet system can be customized for its intended load, with features such as slanted edges on guide rails for fragile items.
    *   The sizes and positions of pallet cap pockets, guide rails, end stops, and end plates can vary depending on the application.
</summary>

<summary>
*   **Invention Overview**
    *  The invention pertains to an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension, which aims to make full use of the limited internal space of the saucer shell and design a rotary-wing system and its power system with a compact structure, reasonable layout, small weight, high motive power conversion efficiency, and easy manipulation and control.
*   **Key Components**
    *  The flying saucer comprises a saucer shell, a saucer cabin, a rotary-wing system, and a control system, with the rotary-wing system being a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system.
*   **Magnetic Suspension Structure**
    *  The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended on the magnetic suspension shaft in the radial direction (X-X) and on the magnetic suspension guide rail in the axial direction (Y-Y) using magnetic suspension bearings.
*   **Improvement Solutions**
    *  Two improvement solutions are proposed to overcome the problem of reactive torque of the rotary wing: coaxial axial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems and coaxial radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems.
</summary>

<summary>

•  **Background of the Invention**
	+ The present invention is concerned with methods of forming substituted guanidines utilizing nickel catalysts.
	+ The methods comprise guanylating amines or pyrrolidines with guanylating agents such as thioureas or isothioureas in the presence of a nickel catalyst.
	+ Suitable Ni(0) catalysts are derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina.

•  **Importance of Guanidines in Drug Development**
	+ Guanidines are important structural components in many biologically active compounds.
	+ They are fully protonated under physiological conditions, forming a positive charge that facilitates specific interactions between ligand and receptor or between enzyme and substrate.
	+ Guanidines are found in various clinically useful drugs, including H2-receptor antagonists, cardiovascular drugs, anti-diabetic drugs, anti-malarial drugs, antibacterial agents, and others.

•  **Limitations of Prior Art Methods**
	+ Prior art methods for synthesizing guanidines involve treating amines with guanylating agents, often requiring large quantities of coupling reagents and bases.
	+ These methods can result in low yields, decomposition, and unwanted side reactions.
	+ The use of toxic reagents or catalysts is also a concern in large-scale industrial drug production.

•  **Inventive Methods and Results**
	+ The inventive methods comprise reacting a compound having the structure Formula I with an amine or pyrrolidine in the presence of a nickel catalyst.
	+ Preferred guanylating agents are thioureas and isothioureas, which have been shown to be effective in guanylation reactions with amines and pyrrolidines.
	+ The inventive methods have been demonstrated to result in high yields of substituted guanidines, with some reactions achieving yields of 100%.

•  **Examples and Results**
	+ Examples 1-6 demonstrate the effectiveness of the inventive methods in synthesizing substituted guanidines using various nickel catalysts and guanylating agents.
	+ The results show that the nickel catalysts can be used in catalytic amounts, and that the reactions can be carried out under mild conditions.
	+ The inventive methods have been shown to be effective in synthesizing a wide range of substituted guanidines, including those with

*   **Background and Objectives**
    *   The invention relates to a novel apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.
    *   The objectives of the invention are to provide an apparatus and method for continuously conducting anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires without requiring a large amount of electrical energy.
    *   The invention aims to provide an apparatus and method for continuously conducting first anodic oxidation and then electrolytic coloring of an aluminum strip or wire for forming a colored anodic coating on the aluminum strip or wire.

*   **Apparatus and Method**
    *   The apparatus consists of a means for continuously supplying an aluminum strip or wire, an anodic oxidation bath, an electrolytic coloring bath, an electric circuit, and a means for passing the aluminum strip or wire continuously and successively through the baths.
    *   The anodic oxidation bath is used to form an anodic coating on the aluminum strip or wire, and the electrolytic coloring bath is used to color the anodic coating.
    *   The electric circuit connects the cathode and anode to a power source and causes the aluminum strip or wire to function as an anode in the anodic oxidation bath and as a cathode in the electrolytic coloring bath.

    *   The anodic oxidation bath composition is usually an aqueous solution of 10 to 55% sulfuric acid.

    *   The thickness of the oxide film formed on the aluminum strip or wire should be thicker than 4 microns.

    *   The bath composition is selected suitably depending on the desired color.
    *   The current density and electrolytic period of time in the bath are controlled by the area of the aluminum strip or wire immersed, the amount of electric current applied, and the period of immersion of the aluminum strip or wire.

*   **Apparatus Embodiment**

<summary>

*   The invention relates to a process of producing transgenic plants transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest and capable of expressing a function of interest from said DNA sequence of interest.
    *   The process involves providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors, each adapted to recombine with at least one other vector.
    *   The vectors are adapted for integrating the DNA sequence of interest into the chromosome, and the DNA sequence of interest contains sequence portions from at least two of the vectors.
    *   The DNA sequence of interest is non-replicating to avoid disease symptoms.
    *   The process allows for the selection of plants or plant cells expressing the function of interest.

*   The invention provides a process of producing different transgenic multi-cellular plants or plant cells transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest and capable of expressing a function of interest from said DNA sequence of interest.
    *   The process involves providing plants or plant cells with a mixture of a primary vector and a set of secondary vectors.
    *   The primary vector and secondary vectors are adapted to recombine with each other by site-specific recombination.
    *   The primary vector and secondary vectors are adapted to integrate the DNA sequence of interest into the chromosome.
    *   The process allows for the selection of transformed plants or plant cells expressing the function of interest.

*   The invention provides a process of assembling a DNA sequence of interest in planta from precursor vectors.
    *   The precursor vectors may contain helper sequences that are absent in the assembled DNA sequence of interest.
    *   The helper sequences may provide genes of interest necessary for assembly of the DNA sequence of interest.
    *   The assembly of the DNA sequence of interest can be facilitated by the presence of helper sequences.
    *   The process allows for the selection of plant cells with the DNA sequence of interest integrated into the chromosomal DNA.

*   The invention provides a process of generating different allelic vectors from a DNA sequence of interest assembled in planta.
    *   The DNA sequence of interest can be further exposed to a transposase of choice.
    *   The transposase can remove targeted sequences flanked by Ds sequences or dSpm sequences.
    *   The final derivative vectors can be allelic in relation to each other.
    *   The approach addresses biosafety issues related to transgene segregation.

    * Background of the Invention
        * The invention relates to a swash plate type compressor for compressing refrigerant gas.
        * The compressor has a swash plate that rotates to reciprocate pistons within cylinder bores.
        * The swash plate facial and end surfaces contact pivoting shoes within the pistons.
        * The invention aims to reduce frictional wear on the components and increase the compressor's efficiency.

    * Description of the Related Art
        * Swash plate compressors have been used in automotive air conditioning systems for many years.
        * The swash plate undergoes a shear-type contact with the piston shoes, causing high friction.
        * Electroplated metal matrix coatings on aluminum components are acceptable under light loads but have disadvantages under high friction loads.
        * Adding fluororesin to the metal matrix improved the coefficient of friction but reduced surface hardness and durability.

    * Summary of the Invention
        * The present invention is directed to a swash plate type compressor with a cylinder block and a rotary shaft.
        * The swash plate has two facial surfaces and an end surface coated with a heat curable, cross-linked coating.
        * The coating comprises a polyfluoro elastomer, a lubricious additive, and a load bearing additive.
        * The coating is applied to the swash plate by means of liquid spray and cured in an oven at an elevated temperature.

    * Detailed Description of the Preferred Embodiments
        * The swash plate is usually made from an aluminum or aluminum alloy material to make it light-weight and strong.
        * The coating process of the present invention does not require a high surface finish on the swash plate.
        * The surface roughening may be formed on the swash plate surfaces by abrasive grit blasting or electro-discharge machining.
        * The coated swash plate exhibits very smooth facial surfaces and end surface.

    * Experimental Results
        * The Fluorolon™325 coated swash plate made with hypereutectic aluminum sustained seizure loads of over ten times greater than uncoated hypereutectic aluminum swash plates.
        * The Fluorolon™325 coated swash plate made with non-hypereutectic aluminum sustained seizure loads of approximately five times those of hypereutectic aluminum swash plates coated with tin or tin/zinc.
        * The load bearing additives do not require the high surface finish metals such as tin and zinc require.
