*   The present invention relates to organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, and methods for preparing them. 
    *   The polymers of the present invention can be used to form a layer which prevents the reflection of light from lower layers coated on a semiconductor chip when photolithography processes using short wavelength light sources are employed during the manufacture of semiconductor devices.
    *   The polymers represented by general formula 1, 2, and 3 can be prepared in accordance with the reaction equations 1, 2, and 3, respectively.
    *   The polymers of the present invention have high solubilities in most of the hydrocarbon solvents, but the anti-reflective coating is rendered insoluble in any solvent after hard-baking.
    *   The polymers of the present invention are superior for use in a photoresist film and do not exhibit problems such as cutting or footing during the pattern formation.

*   The present invention also provides an anti-reflective coating composition containing a polymer of the general formula 1, 2, or 3 alone in an organic solvent.
    *   The anti-reflective coating composition may also comprise one of the polymers of general formula 1, 2, or 3 and a light-absorbing compound selected from the group consisting of anthracene and its derivatives, fluorenone derivatives, fluorene and its derivatives, fluorenol, xanthone, quinazarin, and fluorescein.
    *   The organic solvent used for the preparation can be any suitable conventional organic solvent, preferably a solvent selected from the group consisting of ethyl 3-ethoxypropionate, methyl 3-methoxypropionate, cyclohexanone, propylene glycol, and methyletheracetate.
    *   An anti-reflective coating of the present invention can be provided on a semiconductor silicon wafer by filtering a solution of a polymer of general formula 1, 2, or 3 alone, or a composition containing a polymer of general formula 1, 2, or 3 and one or more of the light-absorbing compounds set forth in Tables 1a and 1b.

• 1.4. The catalyst can be any chromium salt, supported or unsupported, and other metals such as nickel, cobalt, manganese, and zinc can be used as supported or unsupported co-catalysts.

• **Introduction to the Invention**
    • The invention is an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having the formula: 
    • This process uses hypophosphorous acid to improve product yield and reduce the yield of unwanted impurities.

• **Background of the Invention**
    • Pyrazolotriazoles are useful magenta couplers for photographic products, but they are difficult to synthesize.
    • The traditional method of synthesizing pyrazolotriazoles involves a two-step process: ring contraction reaction and hydrolysis and desulfurization.

• **Problem with Traditional Method**
    • The traditional method generates elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities, which are detrimental to the product.
    • These impurities can interfere with subsequent reaction steps and are a potential fogger in photographic systems.

• **Advantages of the Invention**
    • The invention uses hypophosphorous acid to reduce the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities.
    • The use of hypophosphorous acid results in the formation of H2S by-product, which is readily removed from the reaction zone.

• **Preferred Embodiments**
    • The invention provides a process for the preparation of a 3,6-di-substituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole from a triazolothiadiazine precursor.
    • The process involves reacting an acylated compound with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric acid or hydrobromic acid.

• **Examples of the Invention**
    • Example 1: 6-Methyl-3-[1-(4-nitrophenoxy)tridecyl]-1H-pyrazolo-[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole
    • Example 2: 6-t-Butyl-3-(3-nitro-2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1h-pyrazolo-[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole (2b)
</summary>

*   The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from a plurality of fiber types.
    *   The method involves sequentially taking partial quantities from different fiber lots, with each partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity.
    *   The partial quantities are removed continuously only from the measured stored fiber lot.
    *   The method ensures that the opening of all fiber bales is effected without fiber residuals and that an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained.
    *   The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that controls the mode of operation of the opener.
*   The apparatus can be used to remove fibers from various stored fiber lots, with the quantity measuring device measuring the height of the fiber bale.
    *   The control device determines the precise partial quantities to be removed and controls the fiber removing operation.
    *   The control device can be connected to a timer to ensure that the partial quantity is removed not later than at the end of a predetermined period.
    *   The apparatus can be used to remove fibers from a series of textile fiber bales arranged side-by-side on a bale support.
*   The method can be performed using different types of fiber removing apparatus and quantity measuring apparatus.
    *   The fiber removing apparatus can be a plucker, a stripper roll, a spiked apron, or a picker.
    *   The quantity measuring device can be a frequency counter, a weighing device, or a height-measuring arrangement.
    *   The control device can be a programmable control device that receives signals from the quantity measuring device and controls the motors of the fiber removing apparatus.
*   The method can be used to remove fibers from a series of fiber bales with different initial heights.
    *   The partial quantity to be removed from each fiber bale is determined based on the total height of the fiber bale.
    *   The fiber removing apparatus moves onto the next fiber bale only when the entire determined partial quantity has been removed from the previous bale.
    *   The number of passes still to be performed is reduced by one after the determined partial quantity is removed from each fiber bale.
*   The method can be used to remove fibers from a series of fiber bales with different removal periods.
    *   The partial quantity to be removed from each fiber bale is determined based on the total height of the fiber bale and the removal period.

<summary>

•  **Introduction to the Invention**
    • The invention is a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics.
    • The fabric is formed by laying yarns at an angle of 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric.
    • The yarns are held together by stitching, knitting, or adhesive bonding.

•  **Background of the Invention**
    • Traditional fabrics made by knitting or weaving do not provide sufficient strength for modern uses.
    • Non-woven fabrics have been developed for structural uses, but they have limitations.
    • The prior art has not shown a process or apparatus that allows fully parallel courses of bias laid, non-woven fabrics.

•  **Description of the Invention**
    • The invention uses a rake mechanism to achieve parallelism of yarns.
    • The rake mechanism is synchronized with the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism.
    • The rake mechanism allows for the placement of yarns between or on the needles of the conveyors.

•  **Apparatus for Forming the Fabric**
    • The apparatus includes two endless conveyors with needles and a rake system.
    • The yarn carriers move back and forth across the fabric, placing yarns on the conveyors.
    • The rake systems are used to grasp and place the yarns on the conveyors.

•  **Operation of the Apparatus**
    • The yarn carriers are slowed down near the end of their travel to aid in achieving parallelism.
    • The rake systems move in the opposite direction of the fabric formation to grasp the yarns.
    • The yarns are placed on the conveyors, and the process is repeated for each layer.

•  **Advantages of the Invention**
    • The invention allows for the formation of bias laid fabrics with parallel yarns.
    • The density of the fabric can be controlled by overlapping return courses on first courses.
    • The invention provides for a more uniform and stronger fabric.
</summary>

<summary>
• **Problem Statement**
	• The prior art multiple-color air jet looms have a constant weft carrying force for different weft threads, resulting in varying speeds of weft insertion and wasteful consumption of pressurized air.
• **Invention Overview**
	• The present invention provides a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom with varying weft carrying forces to prevent undue consumption of pressurized air.
• **Key Features**
	• The invention includes subnozzles divided into groups with different spacings, orifices, or pressures to produce varying weft carrying forces.
	• The air pressure is controlled by regulators, valves, or pressure regulator valves to supply air under different pressures to the subnozzles or main nozzle.
• **Embodiments**
	• The invention has various embodiments, including different arrangements of subnozzles, regulators, and valves to control the air pressure and weft carrying forces.
</summary>

<summary>
*   The invention relates to a process of making bast fibre yarn through twice health-preserving bast fibres and blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres.
    *   The process involves health preserving bast fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding the health preserved bast fibres, drawing the carded health preserved bast fibres into bast fibre strips, health preserving the bast fibre strips, and spinning the health preserved bast fibre strips into bast fibre yarn.
*   The process has several advantages, including low end breakage rate, improved flexibility, and improved spinnability of bast fibres.
    *   The end breakage rate of yarn is averagely reduced to 150-200 times per hour for each machine when the yarn is 12 s in fineness.
*   The invention can be applied to various types of bast fibres, including jute fibres, kenaf fibres, hemp fibres, and their blends with other fibres.
    *   The weight percentage of jute fibres in bast fibres can range from 20% to 100%, and the weight percentage of bast fibres in the blended fibres can range from 20% to 99%.
</summary>

<summary>
•  The present invention relates to a sensing roll for use in a nip press, which includes strategically-placed sensors to measure the pressure being placed against a web that is being advanced through the nip press.
    •  The sensing roll includes multiple sets of sensors disposed in a particular configuration along the roll cover, with each sensor located at a particular cross-directional position on the roll cover.
    •  The sensors are designed to measure the pressure being exerted on the web as it enters the nip region of the press, and the pressure measurements are used to calculate and display the nip pressure profile and rotational variability profile.
    •  The sensing roll can include a first set of sensors disposed in a particular configuration along the roll cover, with each sensor located at a particular cross-directional position on the roll cover.
    •  The sensing roll can also include additional sets of sensors disposed in a particular configuration along the roll cover, with each sensor located at a particular cross-directional position on the roll cover.
    •  The sensors can be spaced circumferentially apart from each other, and the pressure measurements from each sensor can be averaged to provide a more accurate representation of the pressure being developed at each cross-directional position.
•  The present invention provides a method for sensing and removing the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of a sensing roll of a nip press.
    •  The method includes providing a sensing roll having a working length and a plurality of cross-directional positions disposed along the working length.
    •  The method also includes placing pairs of pressure-measuring sensors at each cross-directional position, with the sensors being spaced apart circumferentially from each other.
    •  The pressure exerted on each sensor of each pair as the sensor moves into the nip region of the nip press can be measured, and the average of each of the two sensors at each cross-directional position can be calculated to determine an average pressure measurement.
    •  The average pressure measurements at each cross-directional position can then be used to provide a nip pressure profile for the nip press.
</summary>

    *   The buttonhole controlling device includes a foot pad and a travelling assembly.

*   **Conclusion**

    *   The apparatus is designed to apply a washing or rinsing solution to the textile web and remove the liquid and substances to be eliminated from the web.
    *   The invention aims to provide an improved apparatus that can treat textile webs without maintaining them in a stacked configuration.
    *   The apparatus is suitable for treating various types of textile webs, including knitted fabrics.

*   The apparatus comprises a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
    *   The conveyor includes an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a predetermined horizontal path.
    *   The liquid applicator is disposed at a first station along the path for applying the liquid to the web during motion.
    *   The suction device is disposed at a second station along the path for removing the liquid from the web by suction.

*   The dwell stretch is designed to conduct the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop.
    *   The dwell stretch can be formed by an air pass or a freely rotatable drum.
    *   The air pass includes a trio of lower rollers and a pair of upper rollers for guiding the web in a plurality of vertically extending loops.
    *   The freely rotatable drum is disposed above the upper section of the sieve belt and includes at least two rollers for guiding the web to and from the drum.

*   The apparatus can have a compact construction, and the suction device is advantageously disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt.
    *   The suction device causes the textile web to adhere to the belt and to be entrained thereby.

•  **Background and Problem Statement**
    • The conventional spun bond nonwoven production machines have various disadvantages and limitations, including high levels of turbulence and vorticity, entanglement and grouping of filaments, and difficulties in controlling web formation uniformity.

•  **Prior Art Systems**
    • Eductive (open) systems involve small fixed eductor throat openings, which suffer from frequent plugging and cannot be opened to clear drips and plugs.
    • Non-eductive (closed) systems have fiber spin speed limitations due to structural deflection problems caused by pressurized quench fluid.

•  **Invention Overview**
    • The present invention involves an initial quench chamber and the use of a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width to produce a linear plane of filaments.

•  **Key Features of the Invention**
    • The system uses a single source of air for both quenching and drawing the filaments.
    • The quench fluid undergoes uniform acceleration into the impingement slot, where the drawing force is developed.
    • The drawing chamber is relatively small, and there is substantially no nozzle length parallel to the fiber/air stream.

•  **Advantages of the Invention**
    • The system provides good control of cross-machine uniformity and web formation control.
    • The system is simpler and more efficient compared to conventional eductive and non-eductive systems.
    • The system has fewer system hygiene problems and is easier to clean.

•  **Operating Parameters**
    • The quench air temperature should be maintained in the range of from about 40° F. to 200° F.
    • The air flow rate should be maintained within the range of from 850 cubic meters per hour to 3,400 cubic meters per hour per meter of machine width.

•  **Apparatus and Method**
    • The apparatus includes a spin box, a quench chamber, and a drawing impingement slot.
    • The method involves providing a thermoplastic polymer in fluid condition, spinning the polymer into filaments, and then drawing the filaments through the impingement slot.

•  **Examples and Applications**
    • The invention can be used to form low basis weight webs from fine polypropylene filaments of under 5 denier and production rates over 200 kg per hour per meter of beam width.
    • The invention can be used to form webs from fine or coarse filaments of polyester under 15 denier

<summary>

•  **Introduction to the Invention**
    • The invention relates to fabrics and textiles, particularly cellulosic fabric or textile materials.
    • The invention aims to enhance the utility of textile goods by adding functional additives.
    • The stability or performance of known textile articles with functional additives is not very acceptable.
    • The invention provides a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric or textile material.

•  **Preparation for Application**
    • The preparation comprises a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent.
    • The wool particles or wool powder is preferably of macrofibril size or below.
    • The functional additive is carried by the wool particles.
    • The preparation demonstrates an exceptional functional additive-carrying and retention ability.

•  **Method of Preparing the Preparation**
    • The method comprises pulverizing wool to obtain ultrafine wool powder of macrofibril size.
    • The method may comprise forming an ultrafine wool suspension using the ultrafine wool powder.
    • The method may comprise adding 0.5-2g/l wetting agent and 4-10g/l ultrafine wool powder into water to form the suspension.
    • The method may comprise homogenizing the suspension.

•  **Functional Additives and Properties**
    • The functional additive may include additives for ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial, or other clothing functions.
    • The wool particles or wool powder may have a size of 200 nm or below.
    • The wool particles or wool powder may have a helix or helical structure capable of carrying the functional additives.
    • The functional additive may comprise an anti-UV agent, such as zinc oxide, or titanium oxide.

•  **Application and Testing**
    • The preparation is applied onto the cellulosic fabric material by printing, padding, or foam application.
    • The treated fabric is tested for ultraviolet protection, wicking, and wrinkle recovery properties.
    • The treated fabric shows improved ultraviolet protection, wicking, and wrinkle recovery properties.
    • The treated fabric also shows anti-bacterial properties.

</summary>

•  The machine can be programmed to move the frame quilting table at variable speeds and in any desired direction.
	•  The machine can also be programmed to sew patterns at high speeds and with precision.
	•  The machine includes limit switches to prevent the table's overtravel.
	•  The machine's electronic control components are housed in a separate box and can be controlled by the process controller.

<summary>
*   **Introduction to the Invention**
    *   The invention is related to sewing machines and provides a new device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it into a cut of fabric.
*   **Problem with the Existing Device**
    *   The existing device uses a needle as a stop for the strip of fabric, but it is not suitable for relatively stiff strips of material, such as paperboard, cardboard, plastic, or leather.
*   **Objectives of the Invention**
    *   The invention aims to provide a device that ensures a continuous operation, makes it possible to sew relatively stiff strips of material, and is insensitive to disturbances.
*   **Key Components of the Invention**
    *   The invention includes a control setup with a stop in the feed path of the strip, a control switch, and a setting means for adjusting the position of the stop.
*   **Operation of the Invention**
    *   The device operates by using a strip of material to control the switching functions of the sewing machine, and the stop is moved into the feed path of the strip to prevent feed when the strip is not fed in correct association with the fabric.
*   **Control Mechanism**
    *   The control mechanism includes a two-armed lever, a control cam, and a proximity switch, which work together to control the movement of the stop and the sewing machine.
*   **Advantages of the Invention**
    *   The invention provides a simple, rugged, and economical design for sewing machines, and it is suitable for sewing relatively stiff strips of material.
</summary>

    * The present invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various parts of clothing.
        * This includes the collar of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tanktop, lower end portion of baseball stockings, a neck rope portion of an apron, and the like.

    * The traditional method of forming a tape-shaped knit part in the collar portion of a sweater involves sewing two pieces of tape-shaped knit fabric together.
        * This process is time-consuming and increases the manufacturing cost.

    * The invention aims to provide a connective knitting method of two tape-shaped knit pieces that can be employed in a knitting procedure.
        * This method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces by a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds.

    * The two tape-shaped knit pieces are positioned with a boundary between them in a longitudinal direction on either of the front and the rear needle beds.
        * The final course of both the knit pieces is overlaid, and the overlaid loops are bound off gradually.

    * The knitting machine used in this embodiment is a flat knitting machine with multiple knitting needles disposed on needle beds laid out in a V-form.
        * The rear one of the needle beds is formed movably in the lateral direction.

    * The two pieces of tape-shaped knit fabric are knitted in a specified length by arbitrary needles in different ranges across the boundary in the longitudinal direction of one of the needle beds.
        * When the two pieces of tape-shaped knit fabric reach a specified length, the loop portion of the final course of one of the knit fabrics is transferred to the needles of the other needle bed.

    * The loop of the moving side knit fabric is overlaid on the loop of the fixed side knit fabric, and a new loop is formed on the overlaid part.
        * This process is repeated until the end parts of both knit fabrics are joined.

    * The final end portion of the junction is prevented from loosening the stitch by repeating the sequence of forming a new loop on an overlaid loop.
        * This process is repeated a proper number of times depending on the width of the knit fabric.

    * The end portions of the moving side knit fabric and the fixed side knit fabric are joined by stitching one-by-one as if each loop were knitted in spontaneously.
        * This results in a seamless joint between the two pieces of knit fabric.

<summary>
*   **Problem Statement**
    *  The existing rotary hook arrangements for lockstitch sewing machines have limitations, such as increased needle thread tension and impediments to the thread movement.
    *  The known solutions, such as moving the holding means to a region diametrically opposite the stitch hole, also have their own set of problems.

*   **Invention Overview**
    *  The invention provides a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine that minimizes the impediment to the thread movement.
    *  The holding means that prevent co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing are arranged to hinder the guiding of the needle thread loop as little as possible.

*   **Key Features**
    *  The bobbin housing has a triangular shoulder with a front side face and a rear side face, which are tangential to the generated surface of the bobbin housing.
    *  The spring rod is fastened to a carrier attached to the base plate and extends between the front and rear cams, which are formed on the carrier.

*   **Operation**
    *  The capsule release device gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, creating a narrow gap between the rear side face and the spring rod.
    *  The needle thread loop can then move unhindered through the gap and be pulled back through the stitch hole by the thread feeder.
</summary>

<summary>

*   The invention provides methods for producing silicon-containing nanowire/fiber composites and thin films using liquid silane inks by electrospinning.
    *   The methods involve combining a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent to form a viscous solution.
    *   The solution is then expelled from a nozzle or drawn from a film and exposed to a high electric field, resulting in the formation of continuous fibers that are deposited onto a substrate.
    *   The deposited fibers can be transformed using thermal processing or laser processing to produce polysilane-containing materials, amorphous silicon-containing materials, or crystalline silicon-containing materials.
    *   The invention also provides for the optional application of a coherent, conductive coating to the transformed fibers.

*   The invention provides for the use of four-component and five-component inks in the production of silicon-containing nanowires and fibers.
    *   The four-component inks consist of a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent.
    *   The five-component inks consist of a liquid silane, a polymer, a solid phase, an accelerant, and a solvent.
    *   The solid phase component can be a particulate, photoactive, or reactive compound.
    *   The invention provides for the use of a variety of solid phase components, including metallic particles, semiconducting particles, and polydihydrosilane.

*   The invention provides for the production of an electrically-conducting silicon-composite electrode using the silicon-containing nanowires and fibers produced by the methods of the invention.
    *   The electrode is produced by combining the silicon-containing nanowires and fibers with an ion conducting binder.
    *   The binder can be a polymer that is inherently lithium ion conducting or can become lithium ion conducting by absorbing an electrolyte solution.
    *   The electrode is resistant to cracking from the sizeable volume changes that occur during the lithiation and delithiation processes during cycling.
    *   The electrode can be used in a variety of applications, including lithium ion batteries and other electrochemical devices.
</summary>

<summary>
*   **Background and Problem Statement**
    *  The current thread tension control systems in spool creels have limitations, such as a loss of individual control of tension for each spool.
*   **Related Art**
    *  Previous solutions include electromagnetic brakes, pneumatic biasing arrangements, and braking systems with pressure means.
*   **Summary of the Invention**
    *  The present invention aims to provide an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel where the thread tension for the entire array as well as for individual spool holders can be achieved.
*   **Key Features of the Invention**
    *  The invention includes a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a different corresponding spool holder, and a tensioning lever coupled to the braking element for biasing it.
*   **Biasing Arrangement**
    *  The biasing arrangement is adapted to be activated by fluid pressure and connected to the tensioning lever, allowing for simultaneous setting of all biasing arrangements.
*   **Preferred Embodiments**
    *  The preferred embodiments include a piston/cylinder assembly as the biasing arrangement, and a braking shoe that operates in conjunction with a braking surface on the inner circumference of the braking drum.
</summary>

<summary>
• **Problem Statement**
	• The conventional sewing machine detector has several disadvantages, including the use of rotary reflective discs that are prone to vibration and wear.
	• The reflective discs are difficult and expensive to machine due to their curved shape.
	• The optical fibers used in the conventional detector are subject to significant stress due to their curvature and the vibration of the sewing machine shaft.
	• The power indicating light in the conventional detector can interfere with the control circuitry of the sewing machine.

• **Solution**
	• The present invention uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs to detect the position of the sewing machine needle and the speed of the sewing machine.
	• The light shielding discs are made of light-transmitting synthetic resin and are printed with various light shielding areas and indicator arrows.
	• The optical fiber supporter is designed to support the optical fibers linearly, reducing stress on the fibers and enabling accurate optical axes to be generated.
	• The power indicating optical fiber is run from the module section to the detecting section, eliminating the need for lead wires and reducing the risk of interference with the control circuitry.

• **Advantages**
	• The present invention is capable of stably detecting sewing machine control signals despite shaft vibration due to excessive wear.
	• The invention is less expensive to manufacture and results in a thinner, more compact detecting section.
	• The invention significantly reduces stress imposed on the optical fibers and enables optional and additional optical axes to be generated.
	• The invention provides for the easy generation of accurate optical axes during assembly, which accuracy is maintained for long periods of time.
</summary>

<summary>
*   The present invention is a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
    *   The process involves partial coagulation and drawing, completion of coagulation, washing with water having a non-alkaline pH, and drying.
*   The washing process is critical in achieving a high degree of whiteness, and the water used should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5, and be free from cations in amounts higher than 1.5 mg/l for Ca2+ and 1.0 mg/l for Mg2+.
*   The process according to the invention produces a finished yarn with a high degree of whiteness, and can be carried out with spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min, and the washing process can be carried out at temperatures between 20° and 30° C. and for a period of time between 25 and 40 seconds.
</summary>

    *  The velocity may range from 4.57 to 12.19 meters per second.

    *  The outlet is 26.67 cm from the center of the tank.
    *  The outside diameter of the inlet pipe is 10.16 cm, and of the outlet is 15.24 cm.

<summary>
•  The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. 
    •  The BTR composite structure consists of stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels, which can be curved or flat, and can be arranged in various configurations to achieve optimal structural performance.
•  The invention uses a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process, which employs topology optimization to design materials for specific tasks and applications. 
    •  The FOMD process involves defining the functions and objectives of the material, quantifying the constraints, and using optimization algorithms to find the optimal material design.
</summary>

<summary>

•  The invention relates to a load-limiting device for dissipating energy during a dynamic event, such as an earthquake, and limiting the loads transmitted to the parts of the structure that are difficult to repair or replace.
		•  The device may undergo plastic deformation to limit the loads levied on a structure during a dynamic event and may be replaced and/or removed after plastic deformation.
		•  The device may be used in various structural applications, including buildings, vehicles, aircraft, furniture, roller-coasters, and other structures that experience severe dynamic loads and/or seismic events.

•  The load-limiting device may be attached to a brace in a braced frame structure and may provide biaxial support for the braced frame.
		•  The device may be constructed of a plastic material or a metal-based elasto-plastic material and may have elasto-plastic properties to allow for the formation of a plastic hinge mechanism.
		•  The device may be designed to withstand small loads without plastic deformation and may be able to dissipate energy during many load reversal cycles without premature failure due to cracking and/or buckling.

•  The invention also relates to a method for using a load-limiting device system, which includes providing a braced frame, integrating a load-limiting device into the system, and providing a connection means to connect the load-limiting device to the braced frame.
		•  The method may further include placing the load-limiting device into an existing braced frame with a connection means and periodically checking the load-limiting device for the existence of plastic deformation after dynamic activity.
		•  The method may also include removing a plastically deformed load-limiting device from a braced frame after a dynamic event and replacing it with a new load-limiting device that has not undergone plastic deformation.
</summary>

<summary>
*   The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet that is designed to provide a flophouse facility with individual rooms on the floor of an existing building. The cabinet is composed of an outer casing and an inner casing, which provides excellent mechanical strength and allows for the formation of a clearance between the two casings to house electric devices or shelves.

•  **Introduction to the Invention**
    •  The invention is a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in construction sites.
    •  It is designed to provide a safe work area for workers at heights.
    •  The invention aims to meet safety guidelines and be easy to assemble and disassemble.

•  **Background of the Invention**
    •  Modern construction techniques require safety barriers or guard rails around uncompleted floors.
    •  The barriers are necessary for personal safety and to prevent accidental dislodgement of articles.
    •  Weather barriers may also be necessary to protect the site and workers from inclement weather.

•  **Problem with Existing Solutions**
    •  Existing solutions involve using lengths of lumber stock, which can be damaged and difficult to reuse.
    •  The process of constructing and disassembling these barriers can be time-consuming and labor-intensive.
    •  Existing solutions may not meet safety guidelines and can be expensive.

•  **Objectives of the Invention**
    •  The invention aims to provide a portable and simple guard rail system.
    •  It should be effective in preventing accidental falls and meet safety guidelines.
    •  The system should be easy to assemble and disassemble.

•  **Description of the Invention**
    •  The invention consists of a guard rail support with a flat bottomed base plate and an upright column.
    •  The support has rail supporting brackets, a retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring.
    •  The support can be secured to a floor or ground surface using fastening means.

•  **Concrete-Filled Steel Base**
    •  The invention also includes a concrete-filled steel base for anchoring the guard rail support.
    •  The base has a retaining groove for receiving the base plate of the guard rail support.
    •  The base provides stability and support for the guard rail support.

•  **Assembly of the Safety Barrier**
    •  The guard rail supports are located at set distances apart along the outer edge of a floor.
    •  Lengths of stock lumber are positioned and secured within the rail supporting brackets.
    •  The configuration of the safety barrier can be adjusted to meet specific needs.

•  **Alternative Configurations**
    •  The invention includes alternative configurations for constructing a safety barrier.
    •  One configuration uses overlapping wooden rails, while another uses short stubs of stock lumber.
    •  The choice of configuration depends on the specific

<summary>
*   The invention is a pulsed power device and a method of using the pulsed power device for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR). It uses a combination of pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods to stimulate crude oil reservoirs and increase oil production.
    *   The device can be used in a variety of configurations, including a single-level discharge device, a multi-level discharge device, and an array of multiple tools in multiple wells.
*   The invention includes several embodiments, including a tool designed for operation at a single level in a borehole, a multi-level tool allowing time sequential and variable inductance discharges, and a tool with a single-turn magnetic coil that produces a magnetic pulse with no significant acoustic pulse.
    *   The tool can be used in a variety of applications, including stimulation of hydrocarbon production, separation of fluids produced from oil and gas wells, and removal of impurities from the recovered fluids.
</summary>

<summary>
*   **Introduction to MSE Structures**
    \t*   MSE structures use horizontally positioned soil inclusions to reinforce an earth mass in combination with a facing element.
    \t*   MSE structures can be used for various applications including retaining walls, bridge abutments, dams, seawalls, and dikes.
    \t*   Basic MSE technology involves a repetitive process by which layers of backfill and several horizontally placed soil reinforcing elements are sequentially positioned one atop the other.

*   **Need for a Splice System**
    \t*   Single soil reinforcing elements often cannot be manufactured to the lengths required to adequately reinforce a vertical facing.
    \t*   Longer soil reinforcing elements are required to provide added tensile resistance, but they cannot be safely or feasibly transported to job sites.
    \t*   A system and method of splicing a soil reinforcing element to extend its length are needed.

*   **Splice System and Composite Soil Reinforcing Element**
    \t*   The splice system includes a first wave plate and a second wave plate, each with transverse protrusions to receive and seat transverse wires.
    \t*   The splice system also includes a connective device to couple the first wave plate to the second wave plate.
    \t*   The composite soil reinforcing element includes a soil reinforcing element, a grid-strip, and a splice to couple the soil reinforcing element to the grid-strip.
</summary>

<summary>
*   The existing plow blade designs have limitations, such as complicated manufacturing processes and high costs, which led to the development of a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection.
    *   The new design allows for efficient production and can be tailored to match specific job requirements.
    *   The plow blade can be modified using hand tools, without welding, to control the flow rates and location of the fluid injection.
    *   The design provides a nearly infinite variety of configurations in an economic manner.
*   The plow blade design includes a multiple component assembly that allows for rebuilding and replacing worn parts, reducing maintenance costs.
    *   The flow paths for fluid to exit the blade at controlled locations and with a controlled flow rate are defined by stacking together leading edge sections with flow voids and welding or otherwise attaching them to a blade.
    *   The fluid tube can be extended to terminate at a position towards the bottom of the critical high friction area, maximizing the volume of fluid ejected.
    *   The design allows for varying the number of leading edge sections, the location of stitch welds, and the size of nozzles to tailor the plow for specific applications.
</summary>

    • The invention relates to a building system, specifically stucco type cavity wall construction techniques and resultant consumables, subassemblies, assemblies, etc.
    • The invention aims to provide a building system that allows for larger cladding areas without movement control joints.
    • The invention also aims to provide compliance with building codes NZS3604 and NZS4251.

• **Background of the Invention**
    • The current building regulations restrict exterior panels to a height of 2.4 meters and a width of 4 meters.
    • The invention aims to overcome this limitation by providing a system that can create panels of greater than 2.4 meters in height and/or greater than 4 meters in width without movement joints.
    • The invention also aims to provide a system that can create walls of considerable size and/or non-square or non-rectangular perimeter.

• **Description of the Invention**

    • The plaster matrix penetrates the first mesh, interposes both meshes, attaches to the second mesh, and covers the second mesh.

    • The method comprises fixing battens to the support structure, preparing for the panel creation, applying plaster into and onto the inner mesh and/or to or adjacent to the periphery to provide a base coat of plaster, overlaying the second and levelling coat with a mesh (outer mesh), and applying a third plaster coat onto the second and levelling coat or the second and levelling coat and the at least partially embedded outer mesh.

• **Components and Consumables**
    • Battens: No. 1 framing, rough sawn or gaug

<summary>

    *   The safe has a liner with grooves that receive bar members, which are used to attach the door to the safe.

*   The safe can be constructed using a variety of materials, including concrete and steel, and can be designed to be fire-resistant and tamper-proof.

<summary>

•   **Introduction to the Problem**
    •  The traditional method of measuring fluid pressure in geological formations using standpipes has several disadvantages, including a significant volume that can dampen the true pressures of the formation.
    •  Low-volume pressure transducers were developed to overcome these issues, but they can be influenced by formation pressures above and below the pressure transducer.
    •  The need exists for a more accurate method of measuring fluid pressure in geological formations.

•   **Background of the Invention**
    •  The measurement of pressures in geological formations is crucial for various industries, including civil engineering, hydro-geology, and petroleum engineering.
    •  Traditional methods of measuring pressure include using piezometers, which can be influenced by pressures above and below the pressure measuring apparatus.
    •  The need exists for a method that can accurately measure the fluid pressure in the part of the formation at the same depth, elevation, or vicinity of the pressure sensor.

•   **Summary of the Invention**
    •  The invention provides a more reliable connection system between a pressure sensing location within a cement grouted borehole and the transducer system used to monitor the pressure in the surrounding geological formation.
    •  The invention involves cementing a conduit fitted with a filter at its bottom end in the borehole at a desired location.
    •  The filter is the inlet to the pressure measuring apparatus, and the conduit is pressurized with fluid to clear the conduit of any cement grout during the operation.

•   **Method of Installation**
    •  The method involves forming a borehole in the subterranean formation and placing a conduit into the borehole to a depth so that a bottom inlet end of the conduit is laterally adjacent a location where the formation pressure is to be measured.
    •  A non-return valve is used in the conduit to prevent liquid from passing upwardly all the way through the conduit.
    •  A cementitious material is placed in the borehole until the cementitious material rises at least above the bottom inlet end of the conduit.

•   **Alternative Embodiments**
    •  In one embodiment, the conduit run into the borehole can be constructed with a small diameter tubing pipe connected to a larger diameter tubing section located near the surface.
    •  The installation of the tubing pipe would normally, but not necessarily, be strapped to a grout pipe.
    •  The grouting operation for the borehole is then undertaken, whereupon the non-return valve prevents

<summary>
*   The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function.
    *   The structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between.
*   The structure also includes more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap.
    *   The elastic members are desirably of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice versa easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner.
*   The joint block is placed across the expansion gap, and thus, the adequate management of accuracy of each member if given may be adapted to prevent the differences in level from occurring in any joint portion between the joint block and the traveling path.
    *   The use of a joint block made of the same concrete as that of the traveling path may be adapted to provide more substantially increased slip resistance to the tires.
*   The elastic members and the joint block are fitted to each other detachably by bolting or the like and consequently, may be easily given the maintenance thereof as well.
    *   It would be possible also to mount supporting blocks inside the steps with the joint block between in order to protect the traveling path ends with the thus mounted supporting blocks.
*   The invention is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter, ensures high slip resistance to the tires, permits less occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations and is easy to be given the maintenance.
    *   The elastic members may be easily joined together by mounting, across the expansion gap over the elastic members, the joint block or a backing plate used to mount the joint block.
</summary>

<summary>

*   The present invention relates to a track transport system, specifically a floor track system used in sanitary fluid treatment chambers for transporting food stuffs on wheeled hand trucks.
    *   The system aims to prevent contamination of the brine solution and maintain a sanitary environment within the chamber.
    *   The invention addresses the drawbacks of conventional track transport systems, such as overhead rail systems and wheeled hand trucks, which can contaminate the brine solution and compromise the sanitary conditions.

*   The enclosed floor track system of the present invention prevents the brine solution from entering the wheel channel area and becoming contaminated by the truck wheels.
    *   The system includes a wheel channel with opposed sidewalls, one of which extends upwardly more than the other, and a cover plate attached to the longer sidewall by a hinge.
    *   The vertical space between the shorter sidewall and the cover plate accommodates the axle structure connecting the truck frame to the wheel disposed in the channel.

*   Another embodiment of the enclosed floor track system utilizes inflatable elastomer seals to enclose the interior wheel channel of the track.
    *   The seals are attached along the length of the sidewall top edges and are inflated to prevent the brine solution from entering the guide track channel.
    *   The inflatable seals also act as a brake on the meat-laden hand trucks to prevent movement along the slightly inclined track system.

*   The enclosed floor track system is well adapted for use with hand trucks having horizontally axled wheel structures or those with depending I-beam struts connecting the wheel section to the hand truck frame.
    *   The system segregates the hand truck wheel structure from the environment within the fluid treatment chamber, preventing contamination of the brine solution.
    *   The recovery and reuse of the brine solution preserve natural resources and achieve an economic advantage.

*   The enclosed floor track system is constructed of materials resistant to corrosive attack by the brine solution, such as stainless steel.
    *   The system prevents corrosion of the hand truck wheel bearings and deterioration of the rubber wheels.
    *   The enclosed track system also prevents the brine solution from coming into contact with the hand truck wheels and becoming contaminated.

*   The present invention fulfills a need for an enclosed floor track system that prevents contamination of the brine solution and maintains a sanitary environment within the fluid treatment chamber.
    *   The system allows for the recirculation and reuse of the brine solution without the need for decontaminating the br

<summary>
*   The lock device of the present invention is designed to prevent a boom of a backhoe work machine from being rotated downward by its weight.
    *   The lock device comprises an engaging member, an engaged member, and a guide member, which work together to lock and unlock the boom.
*   The engaging member is a lock plate that is attached to the boom and has a hook part and a slot, while the engaged member is a lock pin that is attached to the boom bracket.
    *   The guide member is a plate that is attached to the boom and guides the lock plate to its lock and release positions.
*   The lock device is designed to be easy to operate and maintain, with a simple mechanism that prevents the lock plate from slipping off the lock pin.
    *   The lock device is also designed to be durable and long-lasting, with a mechanism that prevents the lock plate and lock pin from being damaged by their touching.
*   The lock device is suitable for use in various types of work machines, including excavating devices, loaders, and cranes.
    *   The lock device can be easily assembled and installed on the work machine, with a simple mechanism that requires minimal maintenance.
</summary>

<summary>
    • The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform that allows for precise regulation of suction efficiency.
    • The platform has a central, vacuum portion that is readily adjustable relative to the pool bottom.
    • The apparatus includes a suction head assembly with a generally rectangular, horizontally extending platform and a central portion with an opening and an upwardly extending cylindrical member.
    • The cylindrical member is adapted for interconnection with a flexible suction line and a source of suction such as the pool circulation pump.
    • The platform and cylindrical member are preferably integrally formed from a yieldably deformable plastic material.
    • The apparatus includes a first, or outboard roller assembly connected to the platform proximate each end portion.
    • The outboard roller assembly comprises a pair of spaced apart ribs, or walls, with vertically extending slots and axles that rotatably support rollers.
    • The rollers are adapted to engage the pool bottom and can be vertically adjusted within the slots to adjust the spacing between the pool bottom and the outboard end portions of the platform.
    • The apparatus also includes a second, or inboard roller assembly interconnected with the platform on either side of the central opening.
    • The inboard roller assembly includes a weight housing with spaced apart ribs, or walls, and axles that rotatably carry rollers.
</summary>

<summary>
*   The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from around the interior of a well head and casing. 
    *   The apparatus includes a sub-unit for mounting onto the drill string, which can be placed between any two sections of drill pipe along the drill string.
*   The apparatus provides a retriever section that is substantially circular in shape and slidably movable between the end collars of the sub-unit.
    *   The retriever section is adapted with protruding members for engaging with an extended J-slot of a wear bushing.
*   The apparatus allows for vertical movement of the retriever unit while preventing rotational movement, which helps to prevent damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing.
    *   The retriever unit is free to move vertically along the mandrel section of the sub-unit, yet prevented from freely rotating around the mandrel section.
*   The apparatus can be used to retrieve a wear bushing without the use of a drill bit, and can be easily removable and installable for quickly removing the wear bushing during the drilling operation.
    *   The apparatus can be used to retrieve a wear bushing that has a threaded collar section, by using a retriever section with a threaded lower end section.
</summary>

<summary>
•  The invention is a vibratory tool for downhole use that can selectively allow passage for other tools.
  •  The tool has a modular design that allows for the selection of the number of pistons to match the power required for the particular work string or downhole conditions.

•  The tool has a dump valve that is reconfigured into an annular shape to keep the middle of the tool free and clear, allowing a central passage to exist for wireline operations.
  •  The dump valve opens and closes without slamming against a seat, and the valve is designed to perform in a cyclical loading environment without fatigue or failure.

•  The tool can be operated with or without impacts, depending on the amount of surface overpull applied to the string.
  •  The tool can also be used in stimulation or fishing operations, providing large amplitude vibrations in a tubing string.

•  The tool has a simple and cheap plug that can be dropped into position to seal the lower end of the passage and activate the tool.
  •  The tool can be made to operate with fewer moving parts than previous designs, and the components can be designed to be more beefy and longer-lasting.
</summary>

<summary>
•  The present invention pertains to an apparatus and method of installation for a completely precast concrete retaining wall. 
    •  The retaining wall is made of precast concrete in two discrete, modular parts: a precast concrete face panel with an integral counterfort and a precast base piece.
    •  The face panel has an integral counterfort extending from the rear side of the panel, which provides support and helps to resist overturning forces.
    •  The base piece is generally a rectangular or trapezoidal shaped platform, typically set on grade, and is precast concrete to save on installation and transportation costs.
    •  The connection between the face panel and base piece is made by inserting an end of a piece of rebar into an opening in the other module and then sealing the connection with grout.

•  The invention provides flexibility and customization options, allowing for taller walls and shorter bases, and can be used in various applications, including retaining soil, sand, pebbles, or rocks.
    •  The retaining wall can be designed to withstand various loads, including temporary wind loads, and can be used in different environments, such as highways and railways.
    •  The invention also provides options for additional stability, including the use of H-piles, shear keys, and grout to increase friction between the base and subsurface ground.
    •  The retaining wall can be designed with a vehicle impact barrier, which can be formed and cast-in-place on top of the wall or behind the wall.
    •  The invention can be used in various configurations, including a single wall or multiple walls adjacent to each other, and can be designed with different features, such as openings for drainage and weep holes.
</summary>

<summary>
•  The present invention relates to a down hole heating system for improving production in oil and gas wells with low flow rates due to high oil viscosity and/or paraffin blockage.
    •  The system includes a heat insulating packer and stainless steel collars to contain heat in the production zone and prevent heat loss.
    •  The system also includes a heating unit with electrical resistance type heater rods and a terminal portion encased in a cement block to shield electrical connections from pressures and hostile chemical agents.

•  The down hole heating system addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional approaches: 
    •  The heat is not properly focused where it needs to be, and existing down hole heaters fail due to lack of design elements protecting electrical components from chemical or physical attack.
    •  The system is designed to overcome these shortcomings by focusing heat in the production zone and containing it to promote flow to the production tubing.
    •  The system also includes a method for use, which includes installation of the heat-retaining elements and suitably shielded electrical connections.

•  The present invention provides improved down hole heating systems and methods for oil and gas wells with low flow rates due to high oil viscosity and/or paraffin blockage.
    •  The system is designed to be useful for extended periods of time without interruption for costly repairs due to damage or electrical shorting caused by unit invasion by down hole fluids.
    •  The system is also designed to be more effective in improving oil or gas flow in circumstances when such flow is impeded because of oil viscosity and/or paraffin blockage conditions.
    •  The system can be used in various applications, including treating deep gas wells with an iron sulfide occlusion problem.
</summary>

<summary>
•  The existing composed stave floors have several drawbacks, including a thin sight substrate thickness (2-3 mm) that deforms and detaches when sanded or rushed, and a base substrate that can suffer deformations and changes in dimensions due to the use of glue.
    •  The thin sight substrate thickness also affects the aesthetic properties of the final product, as the forces of mechanical action on "de-rolling" generate a sheet that tends to curl or recover its cylindrical original form.
    •  The existing composed stave floors have a short lifespan and do not allow for corrective maintenance, and the materials are susceptible to scratches and peeling.

•  The present invention aims to solve these problems by providing a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with a sight substrate thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate thickness of at least 12 mm.
    •  The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, adhesion, and horizontal and vertical reinforcement means.
    •  The multidirectional holding means provide a strong and stable bond between the base substrate and sight substrate, preventing displacement or change of dimensions.

•  The present invention also provides improved composed stave floors with a longer lifespan and the ability to provide corrective maintenance, and the floors can be supplied with a pre-applied glaze that eliminates the need for on-site application.
    •  The glaze can be made of aluminum oxide or another metal that provides higher hardness without changing the aesthetic appearance of the floor.
    •  The present invention provides a more durable and long-lasting composed stave floor that meets the physical, aesthetic, and functional requirements of the user.
</summary>

<summary>
*   Ladder Stability and Safety Issues
    *tab*   Ladders can be unstable, especially when positioned against a wall, which can cause them to slip or slide.
    *tab*   The siderails of a ladder can also damage the work surface due to a small contact area.

*   Objectives of the Invention
    *tab*   To provide a non-slip gripping portion for a ladder that grips the work surface without damaging it.
    *tab*   To increase the contact area of the ladder with the work surface, improving lateral stability.

*   Design and Functionality of the Invention
    *tab*   The invention includes a brace assembly with a flange, U-bolt, and clamp that attach to the siderail and rung of the ladder.
    *tab*   The brace assembly allows for the attachment of a resilient pad assembly that pivots to contact the work surface.

*   Benefits and Advantages of the Invention
    *tab*   The invention improves lateral stability and prevents the ladder from slipping or sliding.
    *tab*   It also allows the ladder to straddle corners and contact the work surface with a broad surface area, preventing damage.
</summary>

<summary>
•  The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, defining a collar portion that captures or at least substantially encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion extending between and connecting adjacent collar portions.
    •  The connecting portion can be formed as a bridge and a rib in which the bridge and rib have a generally cruciform shape. The rib can be formed parallel to the collation or at an angle to the collation.
    •  The connecting portion can include a preferentially weakened region to influence separation of the connecting portion from the collar at a desired location. The preferentially weakened region can be formed by a notch in the connecting portion or by a varying cross-sectional area with a smaller cross-sectional area at the desired location.
    •  The fasteners can also be positioned eccentrically relative to their respective sleeves to define a thin-walled sleeve section at the desired location.
•  The plastic material can be a uniform material that is molded over the nail shanks and between the nails. The shape or configuration of the molding around and between the nails can be varied to enhance the rigidity of the strip and to reduce the amount of debris generated when the nail is driven from the strip.
    •  The collars can be formed having a taper or a thinned region at the collar portion closest to the tip of the nail. The taper facilitates penetration of the nail and plastic collar portion into the wood.
    •  The location of the collar on the shank contributes to increasing the penetration of the nail into the wood. Positioning the collar closer to the tip of the nail results in increased nail penetration.
    •  The use of a forward positioned collar or more generally a forwardly positioned collation element or support is not limited to use with a collated nail strip. Rather, such an arrangement can be used with other strip formed fasteners and other strip-formed consumables.
    •  The shape of the collation can be varied to enhance the rigidity of the strip and to reduce the amount of debris generated when the nail is driven from the strip.
</summary>

<summary>
•  The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants, particularly useful in various industries such as aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
  •  The nozzle has a bell or hood-shaped lower section and an injection button with a special design.
  •  The nozzle is designed to be used with both manual cartridges and automatic processes using injection machines.
  •  The nozzle has a precision dispersion of the sealant, allowing for accurate sealing operations.
  •  The nozzle can be used to apply sealants to various parts, including rivets, nuts, and orifices.
  •  The nozzle can be used to apply different types of sealants, including silicones and similar materials.

    *  *The invention relates to sensors, particularly position and motion sensors.*

    *  *Current position sensors generate unwanted electrical signals, such as noise, which can affect the accuracy of the sensor.*
    *  *These noise signals can be divided into low frequency and high frequency noise.*
    *  *High frequency noise can be easily filtered out, but low frequency noise can be a significant problem.*
    *  *Low frequency noise can cause the sensor to draw excessive current, reducing its reliability and lifespan.*

    *  *The invention aims to minimize energy required from each sensor monitoring system.*

    *  *The invention aims to minimize the number of wires required for these systems.*

<summary>
*   The invention relates to a valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, particularly for four-stroke piston engines in automobiles.
    *   The system aims to control valve port openness efficiently and effectively, reducing gas consumption and enhancing engine performance.
*   The standard method of controlling valves uses a timing belt connecting the engine crankshaft to a camshaft, which has cams for each intake and exhaust valve.
    *   The cams displace the valves inwardly to open the ports, while springs close the ports due to their stored energy.
*   The invention proposes a desmodromic valve actuation system, eliminating the need for springs and providing a more efficient and effective control of valve port openness.
    *   The system consists of a linearly reciprocating actuation system interacting with a controllable actuating means that controls valve position.
*   The system is designed to be substantially infinitely variable in displacement, allowing for precise control of valve port openness.
    *   The valve actuation system can be controlled by a computer, enabling operation of any set of pistons and variable valve displacement.
*   The system can be applied to various engine designs, including four-valve and six-valve cylinders.
    *   The invention offers significant advantages over the standard cam/spring valve actuation system, including reduced power consumption, increased performance, and simplified manufacturing and installation.
*   The system can be controlled by a central control system with position information of the hydraulic cylinders, allowing for individual or collective control of gasoline intake for all cylinders.
    *   The invention is capable of a wide variety of further and other embodiments within the spirit and scope of the appended claims.
</summary>

<summary>
•  The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs, and includes a light member with a housing and a lighting control region.
    •  The lighting control region includes a first control channel associated with a first color of light, a second control channel associated with a second color of light, and a neutral channel.
    •  The light member also includes a switch coupled to the housing, operable to control the first control channel.
•  The light member includes one or more light-emitting modules that are releasably coupled to the lighting control region and to one of the channels to emit the white or blue light.
    •  Each module includes a tab that releasably couples the modules to a protrusion on the lighting control region.
    •  The modules can be positioned anywhere along the lighting control region and can be added to or removed from the light member at various locations.
•  The light member can be controlled with two in-line timers, or a single timer that controls both channels.
    •  The timers allow a user to set a time limit for various colors emitting from one or more modules coupled to the light member.
    •  The timers are programmable to set on/off times and to gradually ramp power up/down by varying the DC voltage, thereby creating a dimming effect.
•  The light member can be used with various other types of enclosures and structures, including underneath office or kitchen cabinets to provide lighting beneath the cabinets.
    •  The light member can be coupled together with other light members to provide for a series of light members disposed underneath one or more cabinets.
    •  The light member includes switches that are disposed along either a side or bottom of the light member to provide for accessible control of one or more modules on the light member.
•  The light member can include an optics member that is coupled along a bottom side of the light member to alter and affect the optics and emission of light from one or more of the LEDs.
    •  The optics member can be coupled along the bottom side of the light member by sliding it along the bottom side in a generally horizontal direction parallel to the bottom side.
    •  The optics member can be coupled along the bottom side of the light member by raising it up to the bottom side and snapping or otherwise coupling it in place over the bottom side.
</summary>

<summary>
*   **Problem Statement**
    *   The current flow deflection apparatuses, such as stator blades or rotor blades in a gas turbine, are subjected to high temperatures that exceed the maximum permissible material temperature.
    *   The use of internal cooling channels helps reduce the metal temperature, but it has several disadvantages, including high blade weight, thermal stresses, and complex casting processes.
*   **Invention Overview**
    *   The invention proposes a cooled flow deflection apparatus that avoids the disadvantages of the known apparatus and is simple to produce, flexible, and efficiently cooled.
    *   The essence of the invention is to construct the separating walls as separate inserts that are inserted into the apparatus and secured.
*   **Advantages of the Invention**
    *   The use of inserts has several advantages, including reduced material in the transitional region, no thermal stresses, reduced blade weight, and simplified casting processes.
    *   The cooling system can be easily adjusted by replacing the inserts, and the inserts can be secured using various methods, such as soldering or welding.
*   **Implementation of the Invention**
    *   The invention can be implemented in various ways, including using holders in the form of rails to guide the inserts during insertion and securing them using integral material joints.
    *   The separating walls can be straight or bent into a U-shape, and they can be fixed in the blade tip region or in the blade root region to prevent bulging out.
</summary>

<summary>
• The existing fuel delivery control systems have limitations, such as the Ishida system, which provides only limited throttle control when the main control unit malfunctions.
	• This can lead to restricted vehicle operation, which can be dangerous in certain situations.
	• The Ishida system also lacks a mechanism for smoothly passing control from the main unit to the auxiliary unit.

• The present invention aims to address these limitations by providing a system and method for controlling the fuel delivery system that can be switched between manual and automatic control.
	• The system comprises a control unit that receives signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve positions.
	• The control unit processes these signals to provide a control signal to a DC motor or stepper motor, which sets the throttle valve position for optimum vehicle performance.

• The system allows for smooth switching between automatic and manual control, preventing the vehicle from lurching forward or stalling.
	• The control unit can detect a malfunction or fault and switch to manual control, either at the command of the vehicle operator or automatically.
	• The system can also be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission, allowing for optimal control of the throttle valve based on the transmission ratio.
</summary>

<summary>

• **Background and Problem Statement**
	• The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or directly from waste fuels such as wood waste.
	• Conventional wood waste fuel burners are inefficient in combustion, discharging undesirable amounts of gaseous and particulate pollution.

• **Key Features of the Invention**
	• The invention provides a waste fuel burner that emits discharges of very minimal quantities of particulate materials within the levels permitted by local environmental regulations.
	• The burner operates producing little slag or clinkers, effectively burns wet wood of 70% moisture content, and is self-regulating, easy to control, and has fast response times to changes in the load.

• **Design and Operation of the Burner**
	• The burner includes a primary combustion chamber with a conical pile of waste fuel, preheated underfire air, and high-pressure swirl air to dry and gasify the waste fuel.
	• The volatile gases are partially oxidized in a first or primary combustion chamber, and then partially oxidized again in a second combustion chamber with secondary combustion air to complete combustion.

<summary>

*   **Evaporative Cooling System Overview**
    <tab> *   The system uses a heat exchanger to separate dry and wet sides, keeping evaporating water separate from useful air to achieve sensible cooling.
    <tab> *   The system operates more efficiently by drawing working air from the load (enclosure to be cooled) and using fresh air on the dry side.

*   **System Components and Operation**
    <tab> *   The system includes a heat exchanger with an array of tubular members, a plenum for water reservoir, and blowers for air circulation.
    <tab> *   The system can recirculate return air and bypass cooled air to increase cooling rate and efficiency.

*   **Efficiency and Comparison**
    <tab> *   The system can achieve an efficiency of up to 90% and a dry bulb temperature of 67.8°F, comparable to vapor compression refrigeration units.
    <tab> *   The system has a power consumption of 1-1.5 kilowatts, significantly lower than vapor compression refrigeration units.

*   **Hybrid System Embodiment**
    <tab> *   The hybrid system combines evaporative cooling with vapor compression refrigeration to achieve dehumidification and further cooling.
    <tab> *   The system uses a minor portion of the cooled air stream to pass through the evaporator coil, resulting in a significant reduction in energy required to operate the vapor compression refrigeration unit.

</summary>

*   **Pump Head Components**
    *   Each pump head has a housing that contains an impeller, which is driven by a drive structure to move fluid through the pump head.
    *   The pump head also has a combiner that combines fluid flow from multiple conduits into a single flow of fluid.
*   **Drive Structure**
    *   The drive structure is a key component of the fluid pump, as it imparts rotational motion to the impellers to drive the fluid flow.
    *   The drive structure can be powered by a single power source, such as a motor, and can be connected to multiple drive shafts to drive multiple impellers.
*   **Pump Assembly**
    *   The fluid pump can be mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, to facilitate operation at a fluid reservoir.
    *   The pump assembly can also include additional features, such as an agitator nozzle to encourage mixing of the fluid in the reservoir.
*   **Modularity and Ease of Assembly**
    *   The fluid pump is designed to be modular, with pump heads that can be easily connected and disconnected to facilitate maintenance and repair.
    *   The pump heads can also be easily assembled and disassembled, making it easier to install and maintain the pump.

<summary>

    • The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox.
        • The mounting link is designed to withstand extreme loads caused by blade-off events.
        • The mounting link includes a female link and a male link that can translate relative to each other.

    • The female link receives the male link to form a radial interface that dampens translation.
        • The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by translation.
        • The amount of coulomb damping is determined by the coefficient of friction, geometry, and contact areas of the female and male links.

    • A pin is releasably coupled to the male and female links to selectively retain them.
        • The pin can shear when a sufficiently strong shock or heavy load is applied.
        • The pin can be designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly.

    • The mounting link can limit or prevent damage to the gearbox and its attached peripherals.
        • The mounting link can help prevent the gearbox from detaching from the engine.
        • The pin can be replaced with an intact pin during maintenance following any shock sufficient to break the pin.

    • The invention provides a flexible mounting link that can absorb extreme shocks without detaching the gearbox from the engine.
        • The mounting link can be used in various applications, including aircraft gas turbine engines.
        • The invention can reduce the weight and mass of material required to reinforce associated systems.

    • The female and male links can be formed with any suitable geometry and material.
        • The links can be attached to the engine and gearbox using bolts or other features.
        • The links can be designed to provide a specific level of coulomb damping.

    • The invention can be used in various embodiments, including those with different numbers and locations of peripheral load connections.
        • The invention can be used in various applications, including those with different types of engines and gearboxes.
        • The invention can be used in various industries, including aerospace and automotive.

    • The invention provides a flexible and durable mounting link that can withstand extreme loads.
        • The mounting link can be designed to provide a specific level of coulomb damping.
        • The invention can reduce the weight and mass of material required to reinforce associated systems.
</summary>
