•  The invention is a small arms firing effect simulator for use with military training.
    •  It simulates the sound and flash of small arms fire without modifying the weapon.
    •  The simulator uses a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic with an electrical ignition system.
    •  It produces sound and flash by igniting the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion through the weapon's ejection port.

•  The simulator has a reusable housing that resembles a magazine clip for an M16 rifle.
    •  It contains a battery compartment, a firing control circuit, and a plastic expendable with pyrotechnic charges.
    •  The expendable is designed to be fabricated in an automatic process, reducing cost.
    •  The simulator is packaged to enhance realism and can be used with a MILES unit attached to the weapon.

•  The firing control circuitry is designed to provide automatic and semiautomatic fire.
    •  It uses a bolt interface, a trigger interface, an oscillator control, and a firing counter.
    •  The circuitry also includes a firing decoder, a firing control, and a firing sensor.
    •  The firing sensor provides a signal to the oscillator control and a MILES interface when a charge fires.

•  The simulator produces a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash.
    •  It uses a pyrotechnic simulation of small arms fire without dangerous pressurization of the ignition chamber.
    •  The simulator is designed to be reliable, low maintenance, and reusable.
    •  It provides an inexpensive means to provide realistic training using an actual weapon.

•  The invention has several objects, including providing a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash.
    •  It also aims to provide an inexpensive means to provide realistic training using an actual weapon.
    •  Another object is to provide a reliable, low maintenance, reusable small arms training device.
    •  The invention also aims to provide a pyrotechnic simulation of small arms fire without dangerous pressurization of the ignition chamber.
</summary>

A control valve is disposed in the larger pipe and is actuated by an actuator responsive to the engine operating condition.

<summary>
*   **Improving Cooling Characteristics in Rotary Engines**
    *   *The current in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses in rotary engines disrupts the flow of cooling fluid, leading to vapor film collection and reduced heat transfer.*
    *   *A staggered configuration of spark plug bosses, with each boss offset from the centerplane of the cooling flow passageway, promotes a controlled flow regime and improves heat transfer coefficients.*
*   **Design Features of the Invention**
    *   *The spark plug bosses are arranged to be staggered with respect to the direction of flow, with each boss having a terminal that projects onto a point on the trochoid wall, offset a distance from the centerline of the wall.*
    *   *The bosses are packaged in the housing to form angles with respect to the plane dividing the coolant passage longitudinally and transversely, allowing for high velocity flow and controlled swirling eddies.*
*   **Benefits of the Invention**
    *   *The staggered configuration of spark plug bosses increases the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44% compared to the in-line arrangement, as demonstrated by model studies and calculations.*
    *   *The invention provides a more uniform and flat temperature gradient across the width of the gas side of the wall, reducing the risk of thermal distortion and structural failure.*
</summary>

<summary>
*   The present invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
    *   The method uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves.
*   The flow is determined as a function of control valve position, and the flow change due to closure of one of the parallel flow paths is calculated.
    *   The flow characteristics for each valve of the system with N valves and for the system with N-1 valves are determined during the turbine design process.
*   The test compensation circuit uses control valve positions as feedback and compensates by adjusting the flow through parallel control valves.
    *   The circuit includes a test compensation array, a sample and hold circuit, a multiplier circuit, and a summing circuit to calculate the flow compensation needed for the valves not under test.
*   The method and system of the present invention were tested using a turbine system modeled and simulated in real time.
    *   The results showed that the use of the control valve test compensating control of the present invention reduced the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main (throttle) steam pressure by 95%.
</summary>

<summary>
•  Electronic components produce heat during operation, and free convection cooling may not be sufficient for some applications.
    • In such cases, electric fans are often used to move ambient air across the components.
    • However, traditional fastening techniques for securing cooling fans to an enclosure can increase the product cost.
    • The present invention aims to eliminate the need for fasteners in cooling fan mounting systems.
    • This can be achieved through a novel design that utilizes spring members and recessed portions on the panel.

• The cooling fan assembly of the present invention includes a motor, fan blade, and motor carrier with mounting legs.
    • The motor carrier is coupled to a non-rotatable housing that houses the operative components of the motor.
    • The motor carrier includes a plurality of mounting legs with resilient leg portions and compression gaps.
    • The panel includes recessed portions with openings that correspond to the mounting legs.

• The installation process involves bringing the cooling fan assembly into contact with the panel, applying a compressive force to compress the spring members, and rotating the assembly to move the resilient leg portions into the recessed portions.
    • The compressive force is used to move the turned-out portions of the resilient leg portions into the recessed portions.
    • The rotating force is used to reposition the resilient leg portions into the intermediate and residual openings of the recessed portions.
    • The spring members exert an urging force to prevent the motor carrier from becoming disengaged from its seated position.

• The fully installed position is achieved when the resilient leg portions enter into the residual openings and spring outwardly, capturing each leg portion pair within its respective residual opening.
    • The spring members remain in a compressed state, urging the turned-out portions of the resilient leg portions against the exterior surface of the panel.
    • This design helps to prevent vibrational noise and forces from causing the resilient leg portions to "back out" of their respective residual openings.
    • The novel design eliminates the need for fasteners, reducing the product cost and improving the overall efficiency of the cooling fan mounting system.

• The present invention is applicable in various applications, including the automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation industries.
    • The cooling fan assembly can be used in any application where forced air movement is relied upon for adequate cooling of heat-generating systems.
    • The novel design can be adapted to various types of motors, including electric, hydraulic, and pneumatic motors.
    • The invention provides a cost-effective and efficient solution for cooling fan

*   **Spacecraft Structures and Lightweight Composites**
    *   *Spacecraft structures require advanced lightweight and stiff composite materials.*
    *   *These materials have little inherent damping or vibration dissipation characteristics.*
    *   *This can lead to high vibration levels that compromise instrument functionality.*

*   **Kinematic Mounts and Their Limitations**
    *   *Kinematic mounts have limited success in minimizing loads transmitted to instruments.*
    *   *They are designed to safely carry launch loads but lack provisions for vibration reduction.*
    *   *The six suspension modes introduced by mounts have little damping, amplifying flight loads.*

*   **Objectives of the Present Invention**
    *   *Provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features.*
    *   *Develop a passive energy dissipating mechanism to protect instruments from flight loads.*
    *   *Create a kinematic mount that can be incorporated into existing structures.*

*   **Damped Kinematic Mount Design**
    *   *The design uses six identical strut elements to reduce manufacturing complexity and costs.*
    *   *The strut configuration is rearranged to approximately uncouple the mount suspension modes.*
    *   *The design achieves modal vibration tests with damping values from 5-17% of critical damping.*

*   **Damper Design Embodiments**
    *   *The first embodiment uses a spherical damper with a viscoelastic material.*
    *   *The second embodiment uses a cylindrical slot damper with o-rings or VEM washers.*
    *   *Both designs induce deformation in the viscoelastic material to dissipate vibration energy.*

*   **Benefits of the Proposed Mounting Concept**
    *   *The design simplifies manufacturing by using standard bar stock.*
    *   *The design allows for the use of a center-of-gravity mounting system.*
    *   *The design can provide uncoupled suspension modes for improved performance.*

*   **Alternative Damped KM Design Concepts**
    *   *Truss structures may be used due to their efficient stiffness to weight ratios.*
    *   *A set of three damped versions of the mount configuration may be used.*
    *   *The design can be arranged in various configurations to achieve the desired performance.*

*   **Frequency-Dependent Properties of VEM**
    *   *The VEM shear modulus is high at high frequencies, causing the mount to have higher bending stiffness.*
    *   *At low frequencies, the modulus of the VEM is drastically reduced,

*   The invention is a clutch unit of the oil shear type, designed for large size power transmission requirements, particularly in aircraft catapult systems.
    *   The clutch unit has interleaved clutch plates and discs, with separate means for closing the gap between each clutch disc and its adjacent clutch plates.
*   The clutch unit utilizes hydraulic fluid for dual purposes: retracting the plate actuating means to reduce residual drag and as a coolant for the clutch discs.
    *   The auxiliary fluid supply exerts constant retracting pressure on the clutch plate piston and cylinder means, serving a cooling function for the clutch discs.
*   The clutch unit allows for the easy removal and replacement of individual clutch disc segments without disassembling the entire mechanism.
    *   The segmented clutch discs are mounted in a way that permits the easy removal and replacement of individual segments, with recessed portions on the opposite edges of each clutch disc segment interfitting with bushings.
*   The clutch unit provides a new and improved clutch unit which minimizes residual drag, highly improved cooling, and a minimum amount of disc friction on the disc stack.
    *   The centrifugal force of the oil in the unit positively urges retraction of the clutch plates, reducing residual drag to a minimum.
</summary>

    <tab> *   The engine combines combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders to maximize thermal-to-mechanical energy extraction.
    <tab> *   The expansion cylinders are designed to capture and utilize the heat energy from the exhaust gases, allowing for a significant reduction in heat loss.

*   **Water Injection and Recovery**
    <tab> *   Water is injected into the engine to enhance the expansion process and increase the efficiency of the engine.
    <tab> *   A water recovery system is used to recycle the water, reducing the need for a large water tank and minimizing waste.

*   **Catalytic Conversion and Exhaust Emissions**
    <tab> *   The engine uses catalytic materials to reduce exhaust emissions and improve the overall efficiency of the engine.
    <tab> *   The final exhaust temperature is brought to a low level, allowing for a significant reduction in heat loss and improving the overall thermal-to-mechanical efficiency of the engine.

<summary>
*   The invention aims to prevent the formation of intermetallic areas within welded assemblies, which are sources of the onset of rupture, and to provide a fabrication process that ensures the welded and heat-treated parts have good corrosion resistance.
    *   The invention provides a plate consisting of a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of a layer of intermetallic alloy in contact with the substrate, topped by a layer of metal alloy. On at least one precoated face of the plate, an area situated at the periphery of the plate has the metal alloy layer removed.
*   The precoat is preferably an alloy of aluminum or based on aluminum, and the metal alloy layer of the precoat preferably comprises, by weight, from 8 to 11% of silicon, from 2 to 4% of iron, the remainder of the compound being aluminum and inevitable impurities.
    *   The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed is preferably between 0.2 and 2.2 mm, and the width of the area from which the metal layer has been removed preferably varies.
*   The invention also provides a method that includes the steps of coating a steel plate to obtain a precoat including an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer and, then, on at least one face of the plate, removing the metal alloy layer in an area at the periphery of the plate.
    *   The width of the area may be preferably between 0.2 and 2.2 mm, and the area from which the metal alloy has been removed can be produced by partly eliminating the metal alloy layer on at least one precoated face of the plate by brushing or by means of a laser beam.
*   The invention further provides a part fabrication method wherein a welded blank fabricated according to a preferred embodiment of the present invention is heated to form, by alloying between the steel substrate and the coating, an intermetallic alloy compound, and so as to confer a partially or totally austenitic structure on the steel, then the blank is hot deformed to obtain a part.
    *   The part is cooled at a rate adapted to confer the target mechanical characteristics, and the rate of cooling is preferably above the critical rate for martensitic quenching.
</summary>

    •  The system optimizes energy extraction using an algorithm that accounts for data from weather observations and sensors on the mobile structure.
    •  The algorithm relates these data points to performance models for the mobile structure and adjusts points of sail, rudder rotation, turbine gate openness, and ballast draft to maximize energy recovery.
    •  The system includes computer servers that gather data from various sources, including GPS systems, weather satellites, and weather data resources.
    •  The system also includes a human-machine interface (HMI) that allows remote humans to interact with the system and choose mission-critical navigation plans.

    •  The GPS receiver functions include tracking the position, velocity, and way points of the mobile structure.

    •  The system also includes an advanced physical object detection, identification, and avoidance system that remotely utilizes integrated sensors to detect and avoid physical objects.

•  The SCADA system includes various techniques for use in implementing the concepts of the present invention, including structured programming techniques and object tags.

<summary>
*   The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction.
    *   The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction.
    *   The ring segments are connected to one another via joints that form engagement zones with positively engaging joint contours.
*   The ring segments are cut out from a sheet metal material, preferably punched out as 120° ring segments.
    *   Only three weld points are required for joining together a ring element composed of such flat material ring segments.
    *   The 120° segments can be punched out from a sheet metal strip in close succession.
*   The ring element is produced by welding the ring segments together, preferably using laser welding.
    *   The welding process can be carried out with the addition of welding material, or by local fusing of the material along the joint edges.
    *   The weld seams can taper towards the ring element inner and outer circumferential edges with an obtuse angle.
*   The ring element can be formed into a rolling body guide cage by a forming step, which obtains an axial profiling and a geometry with several rolling body guide structures.
    *   The ring element can be used to form various types of rolling body guide cages, including radial bearing cages, axial bearing cages, and cages for groove and angular ball bearings.
    *   The ring element can be designed to have a wire ring element enclosed in the inner and/or outer edge region to increase its mechanical strength.
*   The ring segments can be joined together in a rotary plate, and then welded together in a welding station.
    *   The ring segments can be punched out from a strip material and then joined together in a stack or ring segment block before being welded.
    *   A material bead can be generated along the edges to be welded, which provides a material volume for filling out the weld seam.
*   The ring element can be designed with various joint contours, including a small widening of the gap during the welding process.
    *   The joint contour can form two engagement tongues that are anchored positively in a corresponding complementary contour.
    *   The run-out of the joint edges to the inner or outer edge can be relatively obtuse, almost 90°.
*   The ring element can be designed with a certain degree of material accumulation, which makes it possible to generate a substantially flat weld point.

*   The invention provides methods and systems for obtaining information related to a customer service location, including requesting coordinates associated with the customer service location, accessing a technician server to direct a global satellite positioning system to obtain the coordinates, and updating one or more databases with the coordinates.
    *   The system includes an input device configured for use by a service technician at the customer service location, a technician server for receiving data transmissions from the input device, and a global positioning satellite system for determining a set of coordinates associated with the input device.
*   The invention also provides methods and systems for generating directions for a service technician traveling from a first customer service location to at least a second customer service location, including obtaining through a technician server at least one set of “from” coordinates associated with the first customer service location and at least one set of “to” coordinates associated with the second customer location, transmitting the “from” and “to” coordinates to a mapping system, and generating directions in the mapping system based on the “to” and the “from” coordinates.
    *   The system includes an input device configured for use by a service technician at a first customer service location, a technician server for receiving data transmissions from the input device, a global positioning satellite system for determining at least one set of “from” coordinates associated with the input device, and a mapping system operatively associated with the input device for generating travel directions based on the “from” and “to” coordinates.
</summary>

<summary>
*   The system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields has two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and one control unit to protect an object against influences of an interfering field.
    *   The control unit combines the six output signals of the two real sensors to three output signals of a virtual sensor using a freely definable kind of averaging.
    *   The algorithm used by the control system may be described as follows: O=L·Ω(M·S), where O is the output signal, L is a 6×6 matrix, Ω is the control algorithm, M is the 6×6 matrix describing the averaging, and S is the 6×1 matrix of the output signals of the real sensors.
*   The system can be used to compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields, and it can also be used to equalize potentially arising feedback effects in the case of using two magnetic field compensation systems in immediate vicinity.
    *   The feedback effects can be accounted for by providing a 6×6 back coupling matrix C, which computationally eliminates the parts of the signals that are crosstalks from an output signal O i to a virtual signal V i.
    *   The 6×1 matrix of the real sensor signals is expanded by the feedback part, and the 6×1 matrix with the virtual sensor signals is calculated from the signals Ŝ expanded by the feedback part.
*   The system can be used in various configurations, including a standard installation with one system, a double installation with two systems operated directly beside each other, and a configuration with two compensation systems arranged directly beside each other.
    *   In the case of a double installation, the output signals for both compensation cages are known inside the control unit, and feedback parts can be taken into consideration in the control structure.
    *   The feedback matrix C can be experimentally determined by applying a signal to an output of the first compensation system and measuring at the second system, which components are absorbed by the sensors of the second system.
</summary>

•  The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy.
  •  The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.

•  The invention aims to provide a remedy for the limitations of conventional CARS microscopy methods.
  •  Conventional methods often rely on the presence of corresponding resonance sites in the sample, which can be absent or insufficient in certain cases.

•  The invention makes it possible to equip a sample that inherently does not possess, or does not possess sufficient, resonance sites with corresponding resonance sites.
  •  This is achieved by introducing a corresponding structure that is not inherently contained in the sample through a bioorthogonal reaction.

•  Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without appreciably interfering with natural processes.
  •  They can be used to introduce a chemical reporter into a sample, which can then be tagged with a complementary functional group.

•  The invention allows dedicated detection of target sites in any samples, for example in cells, without negatively affecting biochemical processes that may continue to occur.
  •  This is achieved by using small molecules that can be introduced deep into a corresponding tissue, without steric hindrance.

•  The invention also makes it possible to generate a stable, reproducible background signal by tagging the non-resonant background with corresponding resonance sites.
  •  This can be achieved by selecting suitable compounds that stand out in contrasting fashion from the structures that are actually of interest.

•  The invention is particularly advantageous for use in CARS microscopy, where the non-resonant background can be used as a counter-stain.
  •  However, conventional methods often rely on a statistical background, which can lead to irreproducible results.

•  The invention allows an increase in specificity and an increase in scattering cross section when necessary.
  •  This is achieved by using bioorthogonal reactions to introduce resonance sites into a sample, which can then be detected using CARS microscopy.

•  The invention is particularly suitable for use in biological samples, where the intelligence of a tag can be combined with the specificity of vibrational spectroscopy.
  •  This allows for simultaneous detection and processing of lipids, which could previously only be sensed separately.

•  The invention can be used in various fields, including biology, medicine, and materials science.
  •  It has the potential to revolution

• **Background of the Invention**
	• Medical equipment for radiation therapy treats tumorous tissue with high-energy radiation.
	• The amount of radiation and its placement must be accurately controlled to ensure both that the tumor receives sufficient radiation to be destroyed, and that the damage to the surrounding and adjacent non-tumorous tissue is minimized.
	• External source radiation therapy uses a radiation source external to the patient to treat internal tumors.

• **Radiation Therapy Planning and Delivery**
	• Radiation treatment plans may be based on a digitized virtual model of the patient's anatomy, built using volumetric medical imaging.
	• Computed Tomography (CT) and Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) are common volumetric medical imaging modalities.
	• The radiation treatment plan may be customized to conform dose to a target region while limiting dose outside that target.

• **Segmentation and Autosegmentation**
	• Segmentation is the process of defining regions of interest (ROIs) within a series of CT images.
	• Autosegmentation programs can automatically define ROIs based on anatomical knowledge and general guidance by a clinician.
	• The results of segmentation are stored in segmentation files, currently under the DICOM standard as DICOM-RT Structure Set files.

	• The present invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources.

	• The system is useful for training, evaluation, and product evaluation purposes.

	• The segmentations are converted to volume models and the volume models are compared to identify volume elements that are missing or extra between the first and second segmentation.

<summary>
• **Introduction to the Invention**
    • The invention relates to data processing systems and floating point operations.
    • It aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation in floating point units.
    • The invention provides a technique for accelerating the effective subtraction operation.

• **Background of the Invention**
    • Data processing systems use floating point format to represent numerical quantities.
    • The floating point format has the disadvantage of requiring more time for addition and subtraction operations.
    • The effective subtraction operation is complex and requires a long time for execution.

• **Features of the Invention**
    • The invention provides an improved data processing system.
    • It provides improved apparatus for executing floating point operations.
    • It uses a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments to accelerate the effective subtraction operation.

• **Summary of the Invention**
    • The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by calculating a difference between a subset of signal positions of an operand exponent argument.
    • The subset difference is used to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions.
    • The procedures are chosen such that when the complete operand argument difference is different from the subset operand argument difference, the correct result fraction is available.

• **Apparatus Implementing the Invention**
    • The apparatus includes a 7-bit subtraction unit and a detection and logic unit.
    • The apparatus also includes a shift and selection logic unit and a selection logic unit.
    • The apparatus uses the subset difference to determine the correct final fraction result.

• **Operation of the Apparatus**
    • The apparatus calculates the difference between the complete operand exponent arguments.
    • The apparatus uses the subset difference to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions.
    • The apparatus selects the correct final fraction result based on the complete operand argument difference.

• **Accelerating the Effective Subtraction Operation**
    • The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by reducing the number of steps required.
    • The invention uses a subset difference to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions.
    • The invention provides a technique for accelerating the effective subtraction operation.

• **Advantages of the Invention**
    • The invention provides an improved data processing system.
    • It provides improved apparatus for executing floating point operations.
    • It accelerates the effective subtraction operation.

• **Conclusion**
    • The invention provides a technique for accelerating the effective subtraction operation.
    • It uses a subset difference to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions.
    • The invention provides an improved data processing system.

<summary>
•  The current system for collecting blood and medical specimens in hospitals is prone to mislabeling errors, which can lead to serious medical risks and high liability for the institution.
	•  The problem is caused by the failure to verify patient identity, use two forms of patient identity, and match the patient information on the printed label to the patient's ID band.
	•  The current system relies on manual comparison of information on the patient's ID band and printed barcode labels, which can lead to errors.
	•  The system also has issues with emergency room patients who may not have a barcode ID band or may be moved to a different bed before registration.

•  The proposed system uses a barcode-based system to track specimens and reduce mislabeling errors.
	•  The system involves storing machine-readable codes on the patient's ID band, order, specimen-taker's ID, and specimen containers.
	•  The system uses an electronic reading means to read and dispatch the machine-readable codes to a processor, which stores them in a relational manner in a database.
	•  The system generates a signal to acquire a specimen from the patient and places the acquired specimen in the container, and stores an indication of this in the database.
</summary>

•  The device can also be used for other applications such as hiking, surveying, and hunting, and can be expanded to include use in other portable applications.
    •  The device can be connected to a separate computer via Bluetooth or other technology to upload and download data, and can be used to provide pre-recorded golf instructions and other features.

<summary>
*   The current design rule checking (DRC) process has several limitations, including the need for manual checking and the possibility of false errors.
    *   The process involves checking a design against a set of design rules, but it does not account for different design rules that may be applicable to different regions of the chip.
    *   This can lead to false errors and slow down the design development cycle.
    *   The process also requires cooperation between the IC designer, the foundry field support engineers, and the foundry itself.
*   The present invention provides a solution to these limitations by applying the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data.
    *   The invention involves creating customized design rules for different types of regions on the chip, such as logic and memory areas.
    *   These customized rules are based on modifying a standard set of logic rules to reflect the needs of each region.
    *   The invention also provides a system and method for creating customized design rule check command files based on modifying a standard logic rule file.
*   The invention ensures that all types of memory regions fulfill all memory rules of their group, and all logic regions fulfill logic and memory rules.
    *   The process is superior to prior art techniques in that it avoids false errors and is more reliable, efficient, etc.
    *   The invention can be applied to any mask pattern database, including one having no memory blocks, or even multiple types of memory blocks.
    *   The only modification required to implement the present invention using conventional GDS formatted data is that different types of memory should be identified in some way.
*   The invention provides a system and method for checking design rules to determine whether or not a logic part of a mask pattern data obeys logic rules and the memory part obeys memory rules.
    *   The invention helps users filter out false errors due to logic rule checks in a memory block, and further helps pinpoint real design rule errors in the mask pattern data.
    *   The invention also provides a system and method for creating customized rules appropriate for different types of memory regions that might be included on a chip.
    *   The invention can be executed on any number of conventional computing systems for creating such customized rules, and/or for performing a design rule check on mask pattern data based on such customized rule sets.
</summary>

<summary>

• **Government Support and Rights**
    • The invention was made with government support under contract F300606-88-D-0025.
    • The government has certain rights in this invention.

• **Continuation-in-Part of U.S. Patent Application**
    • This application is a continuation-in-part of U.S. Patent application Ser. No. 07/790,516.
    • The entire disclosure of the parent application is incorporated herein by reference.

• **Field of the Invention**
    • The invention pertains to the use of waveguide holograms for illuminating objects with specific requirements.
    • Objects such as display holograms or spatial light modulators can be illuminated with waveguide holograms.

• **Background of the Prior Invention**
    • Thin substrate waveguides were previously disclosed in the parent application.
    • These waveguides have a relationship between the width of the incident laser beam and the thickness of the waveguide.

• **Summary of the Invention**
    • Thin substrate waveguides can be used to provide improved, controlled illumination of objects.
    • The illumination system can comprise a thin substrate waveguide optically coupled to a coherent light source.

• **Advantages of Waveguide Hologram Illuminators**
    • WGH illuminators occupy much less space than conventional lens illumination systems.
    • WGH illuminators can achieve high diffraction efficiency and minimize stray light.

• **Challenges and Limitations of WGH Illuminators**
    • WGH illuminators require careful design to achieve high efficiencies over large areas.
    • WGH illuminators can produce two diffracted beams, one out of each side, which can reduce efficiency and introduce noise.

• **Compensating for Illumination Depletion**
    • Illumination depletion can be compensated for by exposing a photographic emulsion to the uncompensated beam.
    • A posteriori compensation can be done by recording the hologram nonuniformly so that the reconstructed beam is uniform.

• **Experimental Configurations**
    • Two basic architectures were used in experiments to record the WGH grating.
    • The first configuration is a modified conventional holographic recording system, while the second configuration uses a prism coupler to couple the reference beam into the waveguide.
</summary>

•  **Introduction to the Invention**
    • The invention relates to testing rotors of dynamoelectric machines, such as electric motors and generators.
    • The invention provides a method and apparatus for testing squirrel cage rotors for induction motors.
    • The goal is to obtain the resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew of the rotor to identify defects.

•  **Background of the Invention**
    • Squirrel cage rotors are mass-produced with a high probability of uniformity and high quality.

    • Quality problems are generally infrequent, but hidden defects do occur, making it necessary to perform low-cost tests on each rotor.

    • Some prior art methods require the use of the dynamoelectric machine stator core.
    • Others use destructive testing techniques.

•  **Objectives of the Invention**
    • The invention aims to provide a novel and improved method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors.
    • The invention aims to provide a novel, economical, and reliable method and apparatus for non-destructive measurement of the resistance and reactance of dynamoelectric machine rotors.
    • The invention aims to provide a novel, economical and reliable method and apparatus for non-destructive measurement of the effective skew of dynamoelectric machine rotors.

    • Current sensing means is provided for sensing the magnitude of the alternating current utilized to magnetize the rotor.

    • The apparatus includes a data acquisition and processing system that controls the acquisition of test data and processes the data to produce useful test results.
    • The system includes a data processor and a control processor that work together to determine the resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor.

<summary>
*   The present disclosure provides a method for securing a mobile device by granting access to native resources of an operating system in response to validating a digital certificate associated with a managed library.
    *   The method includes receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library, and authorizing the request by the manager, which includes information that identifies managed libraries that the managed application is authorized to access.
    *   The manager is effectuated by native instructions and can be configured to deny a managed application's request to access native resources and restrict access to only but a few select managed libraries.
*   The method also includes verifying a digital signature associated with a container that includes the managed application, and loading the managed application.
    *   The title player can be configured to load the managed application in response to user input and determine that the managed application is un-trusted, and the manager can be configured to prevent the managed application from accessing native resources and/or terminate the managed application if it attempts to access native resources or managed libraries for which the managed application has not been authorized to access.
    *   The title player can also be configured to validate a digital signature of the runtime host and launch the runtime host, and the manager can be configured to validate a digital signature of the manager and launch the manager.
*   The method further includes storing the verified executable in a digitally signed container, and transmitting the digitally signed container to a mobile device.
    *   The verification system can be configured to determine what dependencies are required by the executable and either reject the package or forward the package to the signing system, and the verification system can be configured to identify managed libraries that the executables attempt to link at runtime and compare them to a list of approved managed libraries.
    *   The signing system can be configured to generate a hash of the instructions in the container and encrypt the hash with a private key, and the mobile device can be configured to include a public key usable to decrypt the container and compare the hash of the information in the container to the expected result.
</summary>

<summary>
*   **Problem Statement**
    \t*   The traditional implementation of a FIFO queue in overwrite memory environments is ineffective for functional memories.
    \t*   Each update would result in copying the entire queue, which is inefficient.
    \t*   This problem is particularly significant in functional memories where updates are made by copying the path from the root to the point of updating.

*   **Solution Overview**
    \t*   The invention proposes a novel way of implementing a queue using a tree-shaped structure.
    \t*   The tree-shaped structure is designed to reduce the amount of required copying in functional structures.
    \t*   The solution is intended for use in functional memories where updates are made by copying the path from the root to the point of updating.

*   **Key Features of the Solution**
    \t*   The tree-shaped structure is balanced, with all leaf nodes at the same level and internal nodes full except for those on the edges.
    \t*   The solution uses a maximum size for the nodes, which can be adjusted to optimize performance.
    \t*   The tree structure is maintained by adding new nodes and copying the path from the root to the point of updating.

*   **Preferred Embodiments**
    \t*   A header node is added to the tree structure to improve performance and reduce memory usage.
    \t*   The header node contains pointers to the beginning and end of the queue, as well as a bit indicating the direction of the queue.
    \t*   The solution can be inverted in constant time and space by changing the value of the inversion bit.
</summary>

<summary>
• The current EPROM devices have limitations in manufacturing and operation, making it difficult to integrate them with other types of integrated circuits.
		\t• They require special technologies and high voltages for programming and erase operations, which complicates the manufacture technology and increases the cost.
		\t• They also have limited durability and cannot be re-programmed multiple times, which restricts their applications.

• The present invention proposes a novel EPROM device that can be manufactured using existing IC technologies, such as DRAM and logic technologies.
		\t• The EPROM device uses DRAM storage capacitors as the coupling capacitors, which allows for larger capacitance and higher gate coupling ratio, reducing the operation voltages needed.
		\t• The EPROM device can be manufactured using the same procedures as DRAM manufacturing, making it possible to have both DRAM and EPROM devices on the same wafer without adding cost.

• The present invention also proposes a stress effect programmable read only memory (SEPROM) device that uses the damages caused by electrical stresses on common transistors to store data.
		\t• The SEPROM device can be manufactured by any IC technologies and is ideal for embedded applications, as it can store large number of data at very low cost and appears identical to any other transistors.
		\t• The SEPROM device has the potential to support a wide variety of novel applications, but it also has limitations, such as longer writing time and limited re-programming capability.
</summary>

<summary>

*   The invention relates to a method of determining feedback gain for feedback control systems, which permits determining the proper value of feedback gain both easily and accurately, in a short period of time and irrespective of the kind of the subject of control.

    *   The method comprises a first step of provisionally determining a predetermined value of a feedback gain, a second step of executing feedback control by using the provisionally determined feedback gain, a third step of detecting an error between a designated value and an actual value of the subject of control during the execution of the second step, a fourth step of calculating an evaluation value indicative of the character of feedback control according to the error detected in the third step, a fifth step of executing the second to fourth steps repeatedly a plurality of times after provisionally determining a new feedback gain value different from the previous value, and a sixth step of calculating a feedback gain value which can provide for a suitable evaluation value according to the relation between the feedback gain value and the evaluation value obtained through the execution of the fifth step.

    *   The method is particularly useful for determining the proportional gain, integral gain, and differential gain, which are factors influencing the stability, accuracy, and response of control, respectively.

    *   The method can be applied to various types of feedback control systems, including those used in automatic guidance vehicles, and can be easily implemented using a computer system.

*   The invention also relates to a specific embodiment of the method, in which the proportional gain, integral gain, and differential gain are determined using evaluation functions, which are suited for evaluating the influence of the value of each gain on the voltage curve obtained by plotting the error against time axis.

    *   The evaluation functions are used to calculate the optimum values of the proportional gain, integral gain, and differential gain, which are then used to control the feedback gain.

    *   The method can be implemented using a computer system, and can be easily applied to various types of feedback control systems.

    *   The method has the advantage of being able to determine the optimum values of the gains quickly and accurately, without requiring complicated multiple variable analytic processes.

*   The invention also relates to another embodiment of the method, in which the proportional gain, integral gain, and differential gain are determined while the automatic guidance vehicle runs continuously along the running course.

    *   The method comprises a first step of initializing the values of the proportional gain, integral gain, and differential gain, a second step of causing the automatic guidance vehicle to run along the running course,

<summary>
*   The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range.
    *   The zoom lens is designed for photographic cameras and video cameras, with a focus on reducing the physical size and total length.
*   The invention aims to provide a zoom lens with a small F-number, high zoom ratio, and standard image angle at the wide angle end.
    *   The lens system consists of five lens units: a first unit for focusing, a second unit for varying image magnification, a third unit for compensating for image plane shift, a fourth unit for making the diverging light beam almost parallel, and a fifth unit for image formation.
*   The conditions for the fourth and fifth lens units are crucial for achieving good aberration correction.
    *   Condition (1) sets the range of refracting power for the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth unit.
    *   Condition (2) sets the range of refractive power ratio for the second lens in the fifth unit to the whole of the fifth unit.
    *   Condition (3) sets the range of refractive power ratio for the fourth and fifth lenses in the fifth unit.
    *   Condition (4) sets the range of Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth unit.
*   The inequalities of condition (5) represent the refractive power of the second lens unit.
    *   The condition is preferred to be satisfied to achieve a reduction of the physical length of the entire lens system.
*   The fourth and fifth lens units are constructed in specific forms to achieve further improvement of aberration correction.
    *   The fourth lens unit is a bi-convex lens with the rear surface of strong curvature toward the rear.
    *   The fifth lens unit consists of six lenses with specific powers and curvatures.
*   Four numerical examples of specific zoom lenses are provided, each with its own set of parameters and conditions.
    *   The examples demonstrate the achievement of a large relative aperture, high range zoom lens of reduced size.
*   The invention has achieved a great advance in reduction of the size of the zoom lens in terms of the total length.
    *   The total length of the lens system is reduced to as short as L=9.13φ A  to 9.19φ A .
</summary>

<summary>

*   The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, photons, or the like.
    *   The method involves generating a charge pulse in a detector when a particle passes through it, converting the charge pulse into an electric signal, and amplifying the signal.

*   The invention aims to provide a method and device that can detect individual particles and integrate count rates without knowing the expected count or signal rates in advance.
    *   The method and device enable both the detection of individual particles and the integration of count rates as a function of signal rates or desired boundary conditions.

*   The invention proposes discharging a charge pulse or signal from the detector on the low-voltage side to improve the signal/noise ratio and prevent excessive noise.
    *   This allows for the detection and evaluation of small-size signals, which is particularly important when detecting elementary particles.

*   The invention also proposes using a first, fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals and a second, slow amplifier for integrating signals upon exceeding a threshold value of the signal rate.
    *   This enables the measuring or detecting of individual particles at low rates or frequencies while enabling the integration of each of a plurality of signals from at least a threshold value or limit value.

*   The invention further proposes separating signals as a function of the rate by a capacitor preceding the first amplifier or an inductive element preceding the second amplifier.
    *   This allows for the adjustment of the measuring ranges for measuring individual particles or integrating the same, taking into account measuring conditions and/or measuring parameters.

*   The invention also proposes using a material enabling fast charge transport at room temperature, such as diamond, as the detector material.
    *   This enables the detection of individual particles up to high count or signal rates at a high time resolution and the precise and reliable integration of each of a plurality of pulses or signals.

*   The invention proposes using a device with a low-voltage-side tap of the signals, which enables the use of a support capacitor to rapidly compensate for the discharge of the detector.
    *   This prevents the detection of an interfering leakage current in a high-voltage cable and maintains the functionality of the detector even at high ionization rates.

*   The invention can be used in various applications, including particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices, and medical technology.
    *   The invention enables the detection of elementary particles without knowing in advance signal rates to be expected, which is particularly important in scientific examinations

•  The invention is an automatic spin checking apparatus for driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.
    •  The apparatus includes a stationary ring and a movable ring that can be moved towards each other to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly.
    •  The apparatus also includes a torque motor that exerts a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly to attempt to rotate it against the frictional force generated by the rings.

•  The apparatus has a control system that includes a microprocessor, a servo motor, and a display.
    •  The microprocessor controls the operation of the servo motor and the torque motor, and generates signals to the display to provide the operator with a visual indication of the status of the apparatus.
    •  The microprocessor also reads the signals generated by the position sensor and the optical encoder to determine the distance between the rings and the rotational position of the driven disc assembly.

•  The apparatus has a flow chart that shows the sequence of operations performed by the microprocessor during operation of the spin checking apparatus.
    •  The flow chart includes instructions to read the signals generated by the control switches, actuate the servo motor to move the movable ring towards the stationary ring, and read the value of the signal generated by the position sensor.
    •  The flow chart also includes instructions to actuate the torque motor to exert a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly, and read the value of the signal generated by the optical encoder to determine the rotational position of the driven disc assembly.

•  The apparatus can determine whether the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances by comparing the difference signal generated by the position sensor with a standard value.
    •  If the difference signal is less than the standard value, the warpage of the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances, and the microprocessor actuates the servo motor to rotate the ball screw shaft at a relatively fast speed to permit removal of the assembly.
    •  If the difference signal is greater than the standard value, the warpage of the driven disc assembly is beyond specified tolerances, and the microprocessor de-actuates the servo motor to halt further movement of the right ring.

•  The apparatus can generate external indications to the operator of the condition of the tested assembly.
    •  The microprocessor can actuate the display to generate a visible alert to the operator that the assembly is defective.
    •  The microprocessor can also store specific measurements for each assembly being tested for statistical process control.

<summary>

*   The invention relates to face age-estimation and methods, systems, and software therefor.
    *   The face age-estimation problem can be addressed with computer software that has the ability to recognize the ages of individuals in a given photo.
*   Face recognition is one of the most difficult and challenging tasks in computer vision, partly because of large variations in human faces.
    *   Difficulty and challenge is even higher for face age-estimation.
*   The invention is directed to a method of generating a face age-estimation for a face represented by first image data as a function of faces represented by second image data and having assigned landmark points and known ages.
    *   The method includes receiving, by a face age-estimation system, the first image data.
*   A contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm is applied to the first image data so as to generate a first feature vector.
    *   An age classifier is executed on the first feature vector so as to identify an estimated age group for the face represented by the first image data.
*   An aging function is applied to the first feature vector so as to generate the face age-estimation as a function of the assigned landmark points of the second image data.
    *   The face age-estimation system may be implemented by any one or more computing devices.
*   The invention includes a machine-readable storage medium containing machine-executable instructions for performing a method of generating a face age-estimation for a face represented by first image data as a function of faces represented by second image data and having assigned landmark points and known ages.
    *   The machine-executable instructions include a first set of machine-executable instructions for receiving the first image data.
*   The invention includes a computing system that can implement methods of the present disclosure and/or various portions of such methods.
    *   The computing system includes a processor and a memory that communicate with each other, and with other components, via a bus.
*   The invention includes a face age-estimation system that generates aging functions and an age classifier for use in estimating an age of a subject of the first image data.
    *   The face age-estimation system may be implemented by any one or more computing devices.

</summary>

    *   The device includes a controller and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements of pixels.

*   The device can be configured to display a first image with a higher definition than the second image.
    *   The first image can be displayed on a quarter of the definition of the matrix of the display device.
    *   The second image can be displayed on the remaining pixels of the arrangement.
    *   The controller can apply an attenuation function to the light intensity signals of the first image to prevent over-saturation of the second image.
    *   The device can display a first image, essentially monochrome, produced by a night vision sensor or an infrared sensor, merged with the display of a second image, essentially monochrome, produced by an infrared sensor, an echography sensor, or a monochrome or two-color symbology image.
*   The device can be based on a dedicated hardware architecture, offering an advantage in terms of lower consumption in operation.
    *   The device can include a first controller interfaced with three pixels of each arrangement and a second controller interfaced with the remaining pixel of each arrangement.
    *   The two video streams generated by each of the two controllers can have different definitions and refresh frequencies.
    *   The device can display a first image, essentially monochrome, produced by a night vision sensor or an infrared sensor, merged with the display of a second image, essentially monochrome, produced by an infrared sensor, an echography sensor, or a monochrome or two-color symbology image.
    *   The device can display a plurality of combined images, with arrangements of pixels in which pixels are dedicated to different images out of the plurality of images.
*   The device can display a first image originating from a night vision sensor

*   The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, particularly an access and/or ignition control system.
    *   The transmitter has a housing with electronics and a communication means that can be brought into communication with a communication means of the security system located on board the motor vehicle.
*   The problem addressed by the present invention is that of creating a mobile identification transmitter for a keyless activation of a security system of a motor vehicle which possesses an enlarged functionality and has a simple design.
    *   The invention provides a payment element that is removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing, a closure that is separately arranged on the housing, and the identification transmitter can be set in a normal state and in a secure state.
*   The payment element can be removed from the housing of the identification transmitter by the user if necessary, and the payment element can have a microprocessor, wherein the payment element can communicate with the payment system.
    *   The payment element can be designed having a storage device, wherein the payment element can be designed in an additional embodiment of the invention as having an integrated circuit which can have one or multiple microprocessors.
*   The communication means of the payment element advantageously has a range of less than 20 cm, particularly less than 10 cm, and the communication between the payment element and the payment system can be carried out via Bluetooth or via a near field communication technique.
    *   The payment element can have a chip, for example, including a microprocessor, circuit, storage device, etc., in order to carry out payment actions with the payment system.

<summary>
*   The problem of inconsistent image quality in an imaging device due to a decrease in tribo charge of toner after a long period of inactivity is addressed.
    *   The tribo charge of toner decreases over time, affecting image quality.
    *   The imaging device may be put into a "sleep mode" to save energy when not in use.
    *   The device starts warming up and performs imaging operations with toner when it "wakes up" from the sleep mode.
*   A method for charging toner used in an imaging device includes determining one or more periods of inactivity of the imaging device and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity.
    *   The method may also include measuring a toner charge level when the printing machine is recovered from the inactivity.
    *   The toner may be charged to a predetermined level based on a difference between the measured charge of toner and a predetermined level.
    *   The method may be included in a xerographic machine.
*   An apparatus for charging a developer in an imaging device includes an inactivity determining section that determines one or more periods of inactivity of the imaging device and a charging section that charges the toner to a predetermined level.
    *   The inactivity determining section may include a user usage pattern determining section that determines a usage pattern of the user.
    *   The user usage pattern determining section may be "self-learning" and may determine the user pattern using an adaptive algorithm.
    *   The apparatus may also include a predicting section that predicts the next user usage from the determination made by the inactivity determining section.
</summary>

•  **Background and Problem Statement**
    •  The invention relates to a recording/reproducing apparatus with plural heads, particularly a rotary magnetic head type apparatus.
    •  The apparatus requires precise control of bias currents for magneto resistive heads (MR heads) to optimize their operating points.
    •  The existing solutions have limitations, such as difficulty in increasing the number of MR heads and precision in transmitting control information.

•  **Objectives and Solutions**
    •  The invention aims to provide a simple structure for independent and precise regulation of bias currents for plural MR heads.
    •  A control signal generator is provided on the stationary drum side, and a decoder circuit and current supply circuit are provided on the rotary drum side.
    •  The control signals are transmitted over a single channel of a rotary transformer, and the bias currents are set by the decoder circuit.

•  **Regenerative Integrated Circuit Control**
    •  The regenerative integrated circuit is controlled with digital data on three lines, including Data, Clock, and Chip Select (CS) lines.
    •  A control signal generator is provided on the stationary drum side, and a decoder circuit is provided on the rotary drum side.
    •  The three-line signals for controlling the regenerative integrated circuit are supplied from the decoder circuit.

•  **Head Switching and Data Transmission**
    •  Head switching is given priority in every recording or regenerative integrated circuit.
    •  Data are transmitted in the order of head switching signal data and amperage data.
    •  Data which need not be transmitted at every time of head switching are allocated collectively to an area for transmission.

•  **Applicability and Effectiveness**
    •  The invention can be applied to rotary magnetic head type apparatuses and disk apparatuses.
    •  The invention can also be applied to the transmission of frequency-modulated analog signals.
    •  The invention is particularly useful for apparatuses provided with MR heads.

•  **Advantages and Benefits**
    •  The invention enables early finalization of head switching and operating current setting.
    •  The invention prevents failure to reproduce signals and erroneous recording due to a delay in head switching.
    •  The invention allows for stable data recording and reproduction.

•  **Scope and Variations**
    •  The invention is not limited to the above embodiments and various changes and modifications can be made within the spirit and scope of the present invention.
    •  The invention can be applied to other types of

<summary>
•  The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, and improving the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one concealed object in the presence of an adjacent object.
    •  The invention employs a transmitter with a pair of antennae that induce distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and a receiver that senses magnetic fields associated with the currents and produces an output signal dependent upon the sensing of both fields.
•  The invention alleviates the problem of distorted output signal characteristics when two cables are present, running generally in the same direction, by producing two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables.
    •  The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the cables, and the system is capable of producing two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables, allowing for easier and more accurate tracing of one of the cables.
•  The invention uses different techniques to distinguish the currents in the respective cables and to produce an output signal dependent upon the presence of both currents, including different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, and pulse rates.
    •  The receiver is designed to detect the beat frequency signal produced by the combination of the two carrier frequencies, and to produce a pulsating audio output signal that is easier for the operator to distinguish from background noise.
•  The invention is especially useful in an environment where the horizontal separation between the cables is related to the depth of the cable to be located and traced.
    •  The effect achieved by the invention is enhanced by the fact that the field from the transmitter decreases by the inverse cube of the distance between an antennae and a cable.
•  The invention can be modified to use only one of the antennae for cable locating and tracing when only a single cable is present.
    •  The transmitter can be designed to energize only one of the antennae, and the receiver can be optimized by adjustment of a threshold sensitivity control.
•  The invention has a wide range of applications, including locating and tracing buried pipes and cables in various environments.
    •  The invention can be used in a variety of settings, including construction, maintenance, and repair of underground infrastructure.
•  The invention provides a significant improvement over prior art systems and methods for locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects.
    •  The invention allows for easier and more accurate tracing of one of the cables, and can be used in a variety of settings.
•  The invention can be modified and improved upon without departing from the principles and spirit of the invention.

<summary>
•  The invention is an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication.
    •  The apparatus includes a source of power, selective switch means, and a coupler for automatically coupling the telephone network to the speaker device to receive incoming telephone calls on the speaker device when the selector switch is actuated.
•  The invention provides a device which can be used on or in connection with a private telephone line or switchboard extension with a telephone speaker phone.
    •  The device is particularly advantageous for the physically handicapped or for an outpatient during a period of convalescence to respond to an inquiry from trained hospital personnel.
•  The invention includes a timer for controlling the length of time of such interconnection and a bypass switch for bypassing the timer.
    •  The timer can be reset by actuating a hang-up switch to cancel the predetermined time cycle in the timer.
•  The invention provides a simplified, portable, readily connectable, automatic answering service for automatically interconnecting incoming telephone calls with a speaker phone to permit two-way communication by the recipient with the use of a minimum amount of circuitry and with a simple connection.
    •  The device also includes means for switching the device into and out of circuit with the telephone line by actuating a switch on the face of the panel.
</summary>

<summary>

•  **Introduction to the Invention**
    • The invention relates to the field of optical fiber communications and system network design.
    • It aims to reduce or eliminate undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network.
    • The invention utilizes remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplies energy to those optical amplifiers over the same branch cables.

•  **Background of the Invention**
    • The emergence of practical optical fiber amplifiers has led to unprecedented expansion in undersea lightwave communications systems.
    • Transmission capacities for digital data have jumped by an order of magnitude, reaching values in excess of 5 Gb/s.
    • New applications of wavelength-division-multiplexing technologies are poised to raise undersea system capacities by another order of magnitude.

•  **Network Architecture**
    • The invention utilizes a trunk and branch structure with a ring geometry to exhibit strong survivability features.
    • An arbitrary single trunk cut leaves all nodes connected, and communications along the trunk and branch network remain intact.
    • Any number of simultaneous branch cuts simply isolate the corresponding branches, preventing continued communications along those branches.

•  **Key Components of the Invention**
    • The invention includes a hub assembly with remote pumping, a hub assembly without remote pumping, and branch assemblies.
    • The hub assembly with remote pumping consists of a hub, a light emitting power source, and an optical amplifier.
    • The hub assembly without remote pumping consists of a hub only.
    • The branch assemblies consist of a cable station, a light emitting power source, a branch fiber optic cable, and a branching unit.

•  **Operation of the Invention**
    • The light emitting power source supplies energy to the optical amplifier over the branch fiber optic cable.
    • The optical amplifier amplifies attenuated optical fiber cable trunk communication signals using the energy from the light emitting power source.
    • The invention achieves amplification of attenuated signals using solely passive repeaterless components without the requirement of additional optical fiber cable runs.
    • The invention can be applied to other methods of signal multiplexing and may also be used as a terrestrial communications system instead of in an undersea application.

•  **Advantages of the Invention**
    • The invention provides a single optical fiber cable trunk cut maintains full connectivity along the trunk and to all cable stations.
    • Branch fiber optic cable cuts simply isolate the associated cable station without compromising ring integrity.
    • The invention respects sovereignty concerns that often arise in undersea communications networks

<summary>
*   **Introduction to the Invention**
    *   The invention is a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, intended for use with television sets, monitors, and other applications.
*   **Problem with Existing Solutions**
    *   The existing shielding devices have several disadvantages, including requiring a special fastening device, being bulky, and limiting the user's viewing angle.
*   **Object of the Invention**
    *   The object of the invention is to provide an improved extendable shielding device that is easy to use and provides a clear image.
*   **Description of the Invention**
    *   The light-shielding device consists of a number of annular strips that are concentrically nested and essentially enclose one another in a tight manner.
*   **Key Features of the Invention**
    *   The strips are suitable to be fixed in front of a displaying screen and can slide over one another between a pushed-in position and a pushed-out position.
*   **Advantages of the Invention**
    *   The light-shielding device can be folded around the displaying screen, taking up relatively little space, and can be easily fitted to a screen using Velcro.
*   **Variations of the Invention**
    *   The strips can be of solid design or produced by bending plate material, and can be provided with integrated hook or locking elements.
</summary>

<summary>
*   The invention aims to improve communication by automatically detecting when a speaker's rate of speech is too rapid for a listener to comprehend.
    *   The device can monitor the speaker's rate of speech and compare it to a listening rate threshold, which can be based on the listener's language proficiency.
    *   The device can then notify the speaker to slow down or suggest an alternative language that is more suitable for the listener.
*   The device can be implemented in various forms, including a wearable device, a smartphone, or a teleprompter, and can use various technologies such as speech analysis, video analysis, and RFID tags to identify the listener and determine their language proficiency.
    *   The device can also use a database of listener profiles and language proficiency levels to determine the listening rate threshold and suggest alternative languages.
    *   The device can provide various forms of feedback to the speaker, including vibrations, tones, flashing LEDs, displayed messages, and speech messages, to notify them to slow down or change the language.
</summary>

<summary>
•  The invention aims to provide a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, allowing for a higher picture sequence frequency.
    •  This is achieved by modifying the conventional TV camera circuitry to increase the picture sequence frequency.
    •  The device can be used for laboratory and industrial processes that require the optical recording of rapidly changing phenomena.

•  The device comprises a cyclic line counter, a sawtooth generator, and a beam suppression circuit.
    •  The cyclic line counter counts the line pulses and supplies an end-of-count pulse after a certain number of pulses (p).
    •  The sawtooth generator is synchronized with the output pulses of the counter and controls the vertical deviation of the beam.

•  The device can be used to record IR, UV, or X-ray pictures.
    •  The video signals can be digitized and stored in a data processing device for analysis.
    •  The device can be used to record processes that were previously recorded using expensive film cameras.

•  The device allows for a flexible adjustment of the picture scanning time resolution.
    •  The counting capacity of the counter can be adjusted to determine the optimal time resolution.
    •  The device can be used to record processes at different speeds.
</summary>

•  The present invention relates to multimedia communications and provides a technique for handling multimedia calls with clients having legacy phones and services.
    •  The invention allows existing customer premises equipment and existing network elements to be used to support multimedia capabilities.
    •  A blended call is a call that supports voice and multimedia exchanges of information.
    •  The invention prolongs the viability of existing network devices by allowing them to be used to support multimedia capabilities.

•  The invention includes a communication environment with a communication network, clients, and servers.
    •  The communication network may include a packet switched network with SIP enabled devices.
    •  The clients may have customer premises equipment associated with them, including telephone type devices and computer type devices.
    •  The servers may include telephony servers and multimedia servers.

•  The invention includes a methodology for handling incoming and outgoing calls.
    •  The methodology includes routing the call to a blender associated with the telephony server.
    •  The blender initiates two parallel components for the call, a voice component and a multimedia component.
    •  The signaling paths pass through and are controlled by the blender.

•  The invention includes a methodology for handling incoming multimedia calls.
    •  The methodology includes the client IMing the other client with a computer type device.
    •  The multimedia server receives the IM request and references a database to learn which multimedia server serves the address.
    •  The multimedia server contacts the other multimedia server with the IM request.

•  The invention includes a methodology for handling outgoing voice calls.

    •  The telephony server receives the dialed number and references the database to determine if the client supports blended services.

    •  The multimedia server sends an invitation to the client via the blender.

•  The invention may be integrated with an Intelligent Network (IN) for basic call disposition handling.

    •  The multimedia server has access to the signaling path and provides the requested multimedia services for mid

    *   The present invention generally relates to electronic service delivery and specifically to content synchronization frameworks using dynamic attributes and file bundles for connected devices.
